title: pon_de_ring
body:
The signature [[donut]] of [[Mister Donut]].

[[Pon de Lion]] has a pon de ring for a mane.

Favorite snack of [[Fuwawa abyssgard|Fuwawa]] and [[Mococo Abyssgard]], often appearing in pictures of them.

Not to be confused with the [[french cruller]], which has narrower ridges that follow a spiraling pattern.

title: malasada
body:
A traditional [[portugal|Portuguese]] confection made from balls of fried dough coated with sugar. They are popular in many places with a significant Portuguese immigrant population, particularly [[Hawaii]].

Also the regional specialty of the Alola region in [[Pokemon]], due to being based off Hawaii.

title: mochi
body:
A type of [[wagashi]] - a Japanese rice cake made of glutinous [[rice]] pounded into paste and molded into shape. It is a traditional [[food]] for the Japanese [[New Year]] and is commonly sold and eaten during that time.

title: maxx_c
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Earth
[b]Type:[/b] Insect/Effect
During either player's turn: You can send this card from your hand to the Graveyard; this turn, each time your opponent Special Summons a monster(s), immediately draw 1 card. You can only use 1 "Maxx C" per turn.

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 200

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]] card. Known within the community as one of the most powerful "hand trap" cards ever released due to its ability to allow its user to capitalize on their opponent's special summon combo (that has become prevalent in the 2010's onward) and easily find a card(s) to counter them. This often results into the opponent having to stop their summoning combo to prevent the Maxx C's user from gaining more card advantage. Alternately, the opponent will try the "Maxx C challenge", meaning they will special summon as many monsters as possible in an attempt to deck out the opponent. The card was banned from TCG in 2018, but still sees widespread use in the OCG and [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel]].

Its Japanese name is "Proliferating G", with "G" standing for "gokiburi", a Japanese word for [[cockroach]]. The monster itself is depicted as many pairs of shiny eyes, representing cockroaches lurking in the shadows.

title: agano_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Agano[/i] in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Yamada Yuuki (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] and light [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a white [[serafuku]] that exposes her [[midriff]] with a red [[pleated skirt]], [[blue necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[belt]], [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]], and has [[uneven legwear]] where the left leg has a [[single thighhigh]] stocking on a [[garter_straps|garter strap]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, [[smokestack]], and mast worn in a backpack-like arrangement, her three 15.2 cm twin gun mounts controlled by [[joystick]]s, an 8 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her right ankle, and a [[flight deck]] on her left leg.

body:

The weapon has gained meme status in Japan through its sheer absurdity and [[Besiege]] [[Voiceroid]] Let's Plays by Niconico/YouTube user [[Tarachan_(taratya19800)|]].

title: shitty_admiral_(phrase)
body:
A [[meme]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. When [[Akebono (kancolle)|]] is your secretary ship, she will occasionally call you クソ提督 (Kuso Teitoku, lit. "Shitty Admiral"). This "hostility" towards the admiral/player character stems from how she was treated in World War II. 

This tag is only for the phrase itself. Do not use this tag when the [[admiral (kancolle)|Admiral]] is merely acting like a jerk. Use pool #8302 ("Shitty Admiral") instead.

Like [[Kasumi (kancolle)|]], her sharp tongue is based upon her historical namesake being the victim of unfair treatment by the real-life admiral in charge. The captain of Akebono was unjustly scapegoated by the admiral for letting Shoukaku become damaged during the Battle of Coral Sea, even though there was little a destroyer could do about multiple waves of aircraft. She was reassigned to the rear after that, and never again had a prestigious post. Furthermore, on her next escort mission [i][[Albacore (Azur Lane)|USS Albacore]][/i] sank her sister-ship Sazanami. When Akebono went searching for USS Albacore, it delayed her so much the transports she was escorting were also destroyed.

In the battle of Leyte Gulf/Surigao Strait, she was assigned to protect Mogami after a collision with Nachi caused by the admiral's hasty retreat. Mogami was then sunk by air attacks which Akebono was powerless to stop. Akebono was afterward tasked with protecting Nachi from further air attacks in Manila, which resulted in Nachi being destroyed by aircraft and Akebono being severely damaged. Akebono was towed to dock by Ushio, but further air raids destroyed Akebono in Manila Bay alongside [[Akishimo (Kancolle)|]]. Ultimately, Ushio was not only a survivor of the war, but her better war record got her improved anti-air defenses to protect against air raids, while Akebono languished.

title: ushio_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Ushio (Kancolle)|]]. 

Upon reaching kai ni, she gains a green-and-brown [[camouflage]] painted on her [[rigging]], boots and armaments, reflective of her final camo pattern when she was stationed in Yokosuka post-Leyte Gulf. A long [[white ribbon]] is worn like a [[headband]], tied in a bow that flutters behind her ([i]the most obvious difference if she's not depicted wearing her battle rig[/i]), and she has depth charges worn looped on her skirt belt. When taking medium or heavy damage, her CG also now reveals she wears [[rabbit panties]]. Otherwise she retains her base form [[serafuku]] and [[blue skirt]] like [[Akebono Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Akebono's]].

Her pink bunny-gun is replaced with a true-to-life 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type 89 (which she never received in real life, she retained her Type C mounts to the end) on her right [[wristband]], and a platform for two 25 mm triple AA mounts on her left wristband. She also gains [[depth charge|depth charges]] attached to her skirt.

h4. Costumes (Kai Ni-only)

title: barzam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-154 Barzam[/b]

A low-cost mass production [[redesign]]ed [[one-eyed|mono-eye]] variant of the [[Gundam Mk II]] developed to replace the [[Marasai]]. Despite the reduced price, the type was extremely capable, and it was seen by many as the last true flagship [[mobile_suit|MS]] of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]].

title: yahagi_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[Yahagi (Kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]].

[[yahagi (kancolle)|Yahagi]] is the second of her class, after [[noshiro (kancolle)|Noshiro]], to obtain her second remodel on March 31, 2021, although her getting a second remodel had already been known before Noshiro's through a series of trailers for the second Kantai Collection anime, starting with the one shown at the Kancolle Jazz Concert Festival in 2019.

Yahagi has two second remodels, Kai Ni and Kai Ni Tei (2B). Yahagi's Kai Ni form is almost identical to Noshiro's: She switches to a new [[serafuku]] consisting of a black [[pleated skirt]], a black dress shirt worn under a long-sleeved sailor shirt with a [[black sailor collar]], and a black stylized [[necktie]], as well as exchanging her [[red scrunchie]] for a [[white scrunchie|white one]]. She also wears a pair of black [[thighhighs]]. She differs from Noshiro by having her shirt partially open from the bottom and draped over her skirt rather than tucked in, her sleeves stopping mid-forearm rather than at the wrist, allowing her to keep her gloves, and only one set of garter straps is holding her left thighhigh as opposed to both. 

In her Kai Ni Tei form, she switches to a white dress shirt worn under a mostly open long-sleeved black sailor shirt (black sailor collar being kept) and the necktie is now orange. She also eliminates her right thighhigh, similar to her base form. This Kai Ni Tei form is what was apparently shown in the said trailers.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4441709: Base
* !post #4441710: Tei

h4. [i]Agano[/i]-class light cruisers with kai ni

* [[noshiro kai ni (kancolle)|Noshiro]]
* [b]Yahagi[/b]

title: advance_of_zeta
body:
A [[Zeta Gundam]] spin-off showing earlier development and [[prototype design]]s of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]]. 

It was serialized in the monthly publications [[Dengeki Hobby]] Magazine as a photo-novel and in [[Dengeki Daioh]] as a manga from 2002 to 2008.

h4. See also
* [[Advance of Zeta Re-Boot]]

title: neo_zeon
body:
A fictional antagonist [[military]] faction from the [[Gundam]] [[science fiction]] universe. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985.

The succesor faction to [[Zeon]]. Originally called [b][[axis_(gundam)|Axis]] Zeon[/b], changed its name to [b]Neo Zeon[/b] during [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]].

They are enemies of the [[Earth Federation]], its [[earth_federation_space_forces|EFSF]] branch, [[titans_(gundam)|The Titans]] and the [[aeug|AEUG/Karaba]].

A remnant faction from the original members of the First Neo Zeon army commandered by Haman Karn escaped to Mars and renamed themselves [b]ReZeon[/b]. They appear during the events of [[Advance of Zeta Re-Boot]].

title: prayer_beads
body:
Prayer beads or Rosaries are used by members of various religions such as Roman Catholicism ([[rosary]]), Orthodox Christianity ("prayer rope, κομποσκοίνι, [i]komboskini[/i], Чётки, [i]chotki[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prayer_rope) Islam ("مسبحة [i]misbaha[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misbaha), Hinduism" माला, [i]japa mala[/i]),":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hindu_prayer_beads Buddhism ("数珠, [i]shu-zhu[/i], [i]juzu[/i], 念珠, [i]nenju[/i], 佛珠, [i]fo-zhu[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buddhist_prayer_beads ), Sikhism, and Bahá'í Faith to count the repetitions of prayers, chants or devotions. They may also be used for meditation, protection from negative energy, or for relaxation.

If the prayer beads are specifically Christian, tag [[rosary]].

h4. See also:

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prayer_beads

title: circlet
body:
A [[crown]]-like band worn around the head, generally on the forehead. In contrast to a traditional crown, it's open-topped and without any arches or an internal covering. It may also have the appearance of a [[bracelet]].

Not to be confused with a [[tiara]], which is worn much higher (vertically on top of the hair).

title: the_beatles
body:

title: shuriken
body:
A shuriken, commonly known as "throwing stars", is a traditional Japanese concealed [[weapon]] that was generally for [[throwing]], and sometimes stabbing or [[slashing]].

They are sharpened hand-held blades made from a variety of everyday items such as needles, nails, and [[knife|knives]], as well as coins, washers, and other flat plates of metal. Though it is commonly depicted in popular culture as a multiple bladed (usually three or four) throwing weapon with a hole in the middle as a holding point.

This weapon is commonly used by [[ninja]]s.

h4. See also

* [[boomerang]]
* [[dart]]
* [[kunai]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuriken

title: bradamante_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first appearing in the 2018 Christmas event. She is the main heroine of the two Italian epic poems [i]Orlando Innamorato[/i] and [i]Orlando Furioso[/i].

The animation for her Noble Phantasm became famous among the playerbase (to wit, all her ass-related fanart on Pixiv "has its own tag":[https://www.pixiv.net/en/tags/%E3%83%97%E3%83%AA%E3%82%B1%E3%83%84%E3%83%80%E3%83%9E%E3%83%B3%E3%83%86/artworks?s_mode=s_tag]) for featuring a close-up shot of her [[ass]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] that [[gradient hair|tapers off]] to [[blonde hair|blonde]] styled in a [[multi-tied hair|multi-tied]] [[ponytail]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], [[sidelocks]], [[hair intakes]], and [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[swept bangs]]. There's also an [[ahoge]] at the base of her ponytail.

She wears an [[open jacket|open]] [[pink jacket|pink]] [[hooded jacket]] with her [[winter uniform|winter]] [[hasu no sora school uniform|school uniform]]. When in her [[summer uniform]], she instead wears a [[white jacket]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with a [[side_braid|side]] [[ribbon braid]].

The bandages on her leg are also black now.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] is [[very long hair|very long]] [[hair down]] with [[blunt bangs]], a [[tiara]], a [[heart hair ornament]], a traditional [[suntiang]] [[headdress]] and a smaller bow.

title: zero_wing
body:
[b]Zero Wing[/b] is a 1989 side-scrolling shooter arcade [[video game]] developed by [[Toaplan]] and originally published in Japan by [[Namco]] and in North America by Williams Electronics. 

Controlling the ZIG space fighter craft, players assume the role of protagonist Trent in a last-ditch effort to overthrow the [[alien]] [[cyborg]] [[CATS (zero wing)|]]. It was the eighth shoot 'em up game from Toaplan, and their fourteenth video game overall.

Headed by development chief Ōta Toshiaki, Zero Wing was created by most of the same team that previously worked on several projects at Toaplan, initially starting as a project not intended for commercial release but to train new recruits before being ultimately released to the market. Although first launched in arcades, the game was later ported to other platforms, each one featuring several changes or additions compared with the original version.

Zero Wing enjoyed a degree of success in arcades and its home conversions were met with mostly positive reception from critics. The European [[Sega Mega Drive]] version later gained renewed popularity due to the "[[All your base are belong to us (meme)|]]" internet meme, which plays off the badly translated introductory cutscene in [[engrish text|Engrish]]. 

The rights to the title are owned by Tatsujin, a Japanese company formed by Masahiro Yuge. The Mega Drive version was later released in North America by independent publisher [[Retro-Bit]] in 2020.

body:

title: kodachi
body:
The [b]kodachi[/b] (小太刀; "short sword") is a traditional Japanese sword that is similar in length to a [[wakizashi]], but is intended to be wielded as a primary weapon rather a companion to a [[katana]].  A kodachi typically has a slightly more curved blade and a longer grip (for two-handed use) compared to the wakizashi.  The typical purpose of the kodachi was to allow those not of the [[samurai]] class (and thus forbidden to carry a katana) to be armed.

h4. See also

* [[short sword]]
* [[ninjatou]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: ninjatou
body:
The Ninjatou (忍者刀), also known as ninjaken (忍者剣) or shinobigatana (忍刀), is the most common name for the [[katana]] that the [[ninja]] were thought to have carried.  It is often depicted as being a [[short sword]], often portrayed as having a straight blade with a square tsuba. There is no historical evidence of the 'ninjatou', and modern depictions of the sword originate from portrayals that were seen in early Hollywood movies.

h4. See also

* [[short sword]]
* [[kodachi]]
* [[List of weapons]]

Not to be confused with [[light trail]].

title: enjoji_jin
body: Jin, also known as Jiji, is a supporting character of the manga series [[Dandadan]]. He is [[Ayase Momo]]'s childhood friend, also unknowingly her first crush, who he lost touch with after moving away. Years later, he enrolls into [[Ayase Momo]]'s high school and reunites with her after he came to her grandmother for help to rid his house of the [[Evil Eye (Dandadan)|]] haunting him, which leads to him becoming the yokai's vessel. After the [[Evil Eye (Dandadan)|]] is kept under control by [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]], Jiji becomes one of the few to lend his help to [[Ayase Momo]] and [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]] as they try to find the latter's kintama.

title: oounabara_to_wadanohara
body:
Oounabara to Wadanohara (commonly translated as [b]Wadanohara and the Great Blue Sea[/b]) is a pseudo-RPG with a heavy story focus made by [[Funamusea (artist)|]] in [[RPG Maker|RPG Maker 2000]], released December 21, 2013. A manga adaptation of the story was released the same month in 2015 and published by [[KADOKAWA]] and [b]Seven Seas Entertainment[/b].

On February 1, 2020 a reboot of the original game with additional content was announced by [[Funamusea (artist)|]] on Twitter and subsequently released on her website.

h4.Characters
* [[Dolphi (funamusea)|]]
* [[Fukami (funamusea)|]]
* [[Idate (funamusea)|]] (aka Orca)
* [[Chlomaki (funamusea)|]] (aka Chlomaki)

title: lobco_(funamusea)
body:
Lobco is a humanoid lobster from [[Oounabara to Wadanohara|Wadanohara and the Great Blue Sea]]. She is one of [[Chlomaki (funamusea)|]]'s familiars and often goes off with her away from the sea.

Lobco has red, curly hair falling just below her shoulders. Four antennae like hairs stick out from the top of her head, two long and two short. Her eyes are dark red in game, but black in her official art. Her pupils are a lighter red.

Her shirt is black with eight yellow buttons on the front and two yellow stripes lining either side of the buttons. The cuffs of her sleeves are a dark gray. Her skirt is also black. In her game sprite a yellow line accents the edge of her skirt, but this is missing from her official art. A red chain can be seen hanging from the side of her skirt.

Lobco also wears dark gray tights, white gloves and long black boots with white laces.

title: super_gt
body:
A Japanese grand touring [[racing]] series, originally launched in 1993 as the [b]Zen Nihon GT Senshuken[/b] (aka [b]All Japan Grand Touring Car Championship[/b]).

There are two classes of [[racecar]] in Super GT, GT500 and GT300. The GT500 class is comprised of manufacturer supported teams from [[Toyota]], [[Nissan]], and [[Honda]] with purpose-built racecars loosely based on production vehicles featuring performance rivaling non-hybrid Le Mans Prototypes and largely equivalent to the Class 1 cars from [[Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters|DTM]]. GT300 is a more mixed class, featuring FIA GT3 spec vehicles from foreign manufacturers alongside Super GT's own JAF-GT spec vehicles.

Super GT is notable for being one of the few remaining major motorsport series to feature [[race queen]]s.

body:
A carbonated soft [[drink]] brand produced and owned by PepsiCo. It was originally invented in 1940 by two Tennessee beverage bottlers who wanted a mixer for their [[whiskey]]. The drink has a citrus flavor and a bright green color, and contains caffeine and various other ingredients that may or may not be good for you.

Popular among [[video game]] enthusiasts, action [[playing sports|sports]] fans, and people who like to drink things that look like [[radioactive]] waste.

title: large_hands
body:
Hands that are larger than normal. More specifically, the hands tend to be as big as the head, or slightly bigger.  This does not take into account [[perspective]] or [[foreshortening]].

Having hands larger than normal is generally considered to be a masculine trait that some find attractive, so much so it has become a trope in the [[yaoi]] genre, often called "Yaoi hands". However, large hands can be a character design choice as well, especially as a way to imply that the character isn't completely "human". Since this design choice is not very common, the hand sizes for such characters tend to be more variable, especially in fan art.

Not to be confused with [[oversized forearms]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6443268: [[Franky (one piece)|]] ([[One Piece]]) 
* !post #7005666: [[Ashiya Douman (fate)|]][br]([[Fate/Grand Order]]) 
* !post #4253264: [[Mountain (arknights)|]] ([[Arknights]])

h4. See also

* [[hand size difference]]
* [[small hands]]
* [[large feet]]

title: kirisame_marisa
body:
"Ordinary Black Magician" and second main protagonist of the [[Touhou]] series. The sole playable character of [[100th Black Market]], where her eye color changed from [[yellow eyes|yellow]] to [[red eyes|red]].

Marisa flies by [[broom riding|riding]] a [[broom]] and fuels her magic with phantasmal [[mushroom]]s, which have given occasion to countless fanon jokes. Uses the [[Master Spark]] move when fighting, which she powers with her favorite artifact, the [[mini-hakkero]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[single braid|single]] [[side braid]] tied with a [[hair bow]]. Her outfit varies, but is usually some variation of a [[black hat|black]] [[witch hat]] with [[frilled hat|frills]], a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[black vest]] over a [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt]], a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[white socks]], and either [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]] or [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].

h4. Appearance

title: tracen_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the characters of [[Umamusume]] as well as their basic outfit.

The [[summer uniform]] consists of a [[purple shirt|purple]] [[sailor shirt|sailor blouse]] with white accents and [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[purple bowtie]] held with a [[horseshoe ornament]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt]], and [[white thighhighs]] or [[over-kneehighs]]; as well as [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]] with medium heels.

The [[winter uniform]] has mostly the same design, but the blouse having [[long sleeves]] with dark purple highlights. Meanwhile, the bowtie is now [[white bowtie|white]], the skirt is [[purple skirt|purple]] instead of white, and the [[purple thighhighs|knee socks are purple]] with a white line decoration. 

Additionally, the uniform includes short black [[bike shorts]] worn [[bike_shorts_under_skirt|under the skirt]] 

h4. Examples

* !post #3076018: [[Summer uniform]]
* !post #7360132: [[Winter uniform]]

title: little_bel_(azur_lane)
body:
A [[aged down|younger]] version of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Belfast (azur lane)|]], also called "[i]Bel-chan[/i]".

Created when Belfast walked in on an experiment being conducted by [[Akashi (azur lane)|]] and [[Yuubari (azur lane)|]]. She refers to herself as Belfast and refers to her regular version or adult counterpart as her older sister. Her regular/adult counterpart explains that as a shipgirl, she was born in her current form and was never younger or smaller. No one was able to explain exactly what Belchan is in-game.

title: bkub
body:
Artist known for [[bkub (style)|his distinctive art style]] and surreal sense of humor. Typically depicted as a [[Duckman|duck-like humanoid]], though in FF14 contexts [[Bkub Duck|his avatar]] may be used instead; he also has a [[bkub (VTuber)|VTuber]] avatar for streaming use.

His most notable comics include [[Poptepipic]], a story about two maladjusted girls doing random, odd things; a Touhou series where everyone seems to be reading too much into each other except for Chen who never says anything; an Idolmaster Cinderella Girls series which stars the unit Ankira; [[Risubokkuri]], about a squirrel trying to persuade a girl into making him her pet; and [[3LDKM]], a story about an apartment that comes with a robot maid.

title: class_card_(prisma_illya)
body:
Magical artifacts created to allow for the summoning of heroic spirits similar to Servants that instead allows the user to borrow their powers & abilities. They serve as a major plot point in [[Fate/kaleid liner Prisma Illya]].

They have two main functions, [b]Include[/b] and [b]Install[/b]. Inclusion allows for the wielder to materialize a weapon or Noble Phantasm belonging to the heroic spirit, while installing manifests the servant directly into the user's body, including their [[cosplay|appearance]].

The cards can also manifest independently as blackened Servants, acting as weaker versions of their own selves.

h4. Known Cards & Users

title: tareme
body:
Eyes drawn with the top eyelid slanted outwards, to the point where the outer corner of the eye is much lower than the inner corner. 
This usually produces a weak, gentle look and is generally given to characters with soft personalities (naturally, exceptions exist). Also known as a negative canthal tilt.

Opposite is [[tsurime]], which usually produces a strong, piercing look.

h4. Examples

* !post #5491998: [[Hiiragi Tsukasa|Tsukasa]] of [[Lucky Star]]
* !post #3133305: [[RO-500 (kancolle)|]] of [[Kantai Collection]]

title: tsurime
body:
Eyes drawn with the top eyelid slanting inwards. This usually produces a strong, piercing look and is generally given to characters with forceful personalities (naturally, exceptions exist). Also known as a positive canthal tilt or slanted eyes.

Opposite is [[tareme]], which usually produces a gentle, weak look.

h4. Examples

* !post #2510395: [[Hiiragi Kagami|Kagami]] of [[Lucky Star]]
* !post #2468323: [[Kashima (kancolle)|]] of [[Kantai Collection]]
* !post #7772503: Above - Tsurime, Below - Normal tilted eyes

h4. Related tags

* [[jitome]] - eyes topped with a flat line
* [[sanpaku]] - eyes that show white primarily above or below the iris
* [[tareme]] - eyes with a rounded, downturned shape
* tsurime - eyes with an upward outer "point"

title: boeing_787
body:
A long-range twin-engine wide-body [[jet airliner|airliner]] that seats 210-330 passengers. Entering service in 2011 with [[All Nippon Airways]] as its launch customer, the Dreamliner has a lightweight fuselage made from composite materials and is powered by 2 high-bypass (better fuel efficiency) [[jet engine|turbofan engines]] with distinctive chevron-shaped exhausts for noise reduction. It also features only four cockpit windows rather than six. 

Inside, the [[cockpit|flight deck]] features a "glass cockpit":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glass_cockpit with digital displays, and the passenger cabin has improved pressurization (equivalent to that at about 1800 meters above sea level rather than 2500 meters) as well as enlarged windows with electronic dimming rather than manual pull-down shades.

The Dreamliner has had a troubled history (although no hull losses, "unlike its main competitor":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Haneda_Airport_runway_collision]), with it's maiden flight being delayed by two years, its first delivery being delayed by three years, and a project cost overrun of about $10 Billion USD. In 2013, the aircraft was "grounded by the FAA":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_Boeing_787_Dreamliner_grounding after two incidents of fires breaking out onboard that were caused by faulty lithium-ion [[battery|batteries]] which Boeing had outsourced.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* [[Airbus A350]], the 787's main competitor

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Boeing 787":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_787

title: boeing_747
body:

title: shi_ci_dong_wu_cheng
body:
The 诗词动物城 "Animal Poetry City" comic series reimagines the lives of famous Chinese poets as anthropomorphic animals, blending humor, vibrant illustrations, and literary history. Each book in the series introduces a legendary poet, such as Li Bai, presenting their works and life stories in a fun and accessible way. Created by the popular artist 我是小魔 "I'm Xiao Mo," the series aims to make traditional Chinese culture and poetry engaging for readers of all ages, especially younger audiences. Through its unique storytelling, the series brings classic literature to life in a fresh and creative format.

<tn>Please note that there's no official English name yet by the time writing this wiki, and there's only one book about Li Bai. </tn>

title: shin_(dragon_ball)
body:
Character in [[Dragon Ball]], first appearing in [[Dragon Ball Z]]'s [[Majin Buu|Buu]] Saga. The East and Head [[Kaioushin]] of Universe 7, he and his attendant [[Kibito]] come to Earth to warn of Majin Buu's arrival. Often referred to as just [b]Shin[/b] after he appears.

He is often depicted as being short with either [[pink skin|pink]] or [[purple skin]] with [[pointy ears]] and [[white hair]] styled in a [[mohawk]].

[Spoilers]In [[Dragon Ball Daima]], it is revealed that he has two siblings: [[Degesu]] and [[Dr. Arinsu]]. Additionally, it is revealed that Shin's true name is [b]Nahare[/b].[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [[Kibitoshin]]

title: vegeta
body:
A major character in the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise, first introduced in [i][[Dragon Ball Z]][/i].  Vegeta made his appearance in chapter #204 "Sayonara, Son Goku", published in Weekly Shōnen Jump magazine on January 7, 1989, seeking the wish-granting Dragon Balls to achieve immortality.

Prince of the Saiyan race, and the main villain of the Saiyan arc before becoming a reluctant ally of the heroes during the Frieza arc. His family and home world was destroyed by [[Frieza]], and was forced to serve under his wing, until he met and fought against [[Son Goku]].

He always refers to Goku by his Saiyan name "Kakarot", who he regarded as his rival. He later becomes a full ally of the Z-Fighters after the Cell arc, marries [[Bulma]] and together they had two children, [[Trunks (dragon ball)|]] and [[Bra (dragon ball)|]]. Some of his most famous techniques are [[Big Bang Attack]], [[Final Flash]] and [[Galick Gun]].

Voiced by Christopher Sabat in English dub, René García in the latin american spanish dub and [[Horikawa Ryou]] in the Japanese version.

h4. See also
* [[It's over 9000 (meme)]]

title: ruyi
body:
A ruyi (Chinese: 如意; lit. 'as desired', 'as [you] wish') is a Chinese curved decorative object that serves as either a ceremonial scepter in Chinese Buddhism or a talisman symbolizing power and good fortune in Chinese folklore. The "ruyi" image frequently appears as a motif in Asian art.

title: shinano_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[aircraft carrier]] [i]Shinano[/i]. 
Character design by [[Soaryuna]], voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]].

Shinano was introduced in Azur Lane as the first UR (Ultra-Rare) ship of the roster, by way of the [i]Dreamwaker's Butterfly[/i] event on September 17, 2020.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] with [[fox]] features ([[fox ears|ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]]), and [[purple eyes]]. Her outfit is a traditional blue-white [[kimono]] with a [[white skirt]] and white [[thighhighs]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life [[flight deck]] with several 25 mm triple AA mounts and 12 cm 28-tube rocket launchers on each side, while she has three [[katana]] on a hull accessory to her back. She also has [[moon phases]] floating around her as a reference to her in-lore ability to [spoilers]see across multiple timelines[/spoilers] and the fact that she was historically sunk at night/early morning.

h4. Skins

title: shin_getter-1
body:
The main form of [[Shin Getter Robo]], primarily piloted by [[Nagare Ryoma]]. It resembles a taller, bulkier [[Getter-1]] with pupils in its eyes (that move, horrifyingly enough), and behaves like it's alive at times. It possesses large bat-like wings called the Getter Battle Wing, a large imposing Getter Tomahawk (that looks more like a halberd), capable of transforming into a scythe and lance respectively, the ability to fire powerful Getter beams from the head and the abdomen, and the ability to merge with enemy machines. Its most powerful attack is the mighty [[Stoner Sunshine]].

[spoiler]Its ultimate fate was it's merging with the planet [[Mars_(Planet)|Mars]], becoming the [[Getter Emperor]].[/spoiler]

title: zhuang_hat
body:
Headdress of the Zhuang people of China.

Similiar to qitou ('banner head') headwear of the Manchu people, but made from cloth, often with a fold-over design, and often features elements such as a [[hat tassel|tassel]] and dangling strips of cloth ([[lappet]]s).

Has varying different shapes - may be arched, triangular or horned-shape, for example.

h5. Examples
* !post #7793860
* !post #6862614

title: seiza
body:
Formal Japanese [[sitting]] position. Formed by [[kneeling]] on the floor and then resting the buttocks on the heels, keeping the [[legs folded]] under the thighs and the top side of the feet flat on the ground.

If the legs are folded out to either side, it's instead known as [[wariza]], and if they are only to one side, it's called [[yokozuwari]].

h4. Examples
* !post #5993760
* !post #6283987

title: gotterdammerung_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 2: The Eternal Icy Fire Century, Götterdämmerung[/b]
[quote]
The Baldanders of the Wandering Sea: one of the three major organizations of the magecraft world, considered to be the primordial, yet final "wall".
There, no progress or changes in magecraft arising from the evolution of civilization are acknowledged. Only Mystics from the Age of Gods are permitted in this group of mages, making it incompatible with modern human society.
The Shadow Border receives a transmission from an unknown sender containing directions to this new territory. Placing their trust in this uncertain, unconfirmed information, the protagonist and company head towards the island of the Age of Gods, hidden away in the North Sea...
[/quote]
The second Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[Russia]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Ophelia Phamrsolone]]. Set after 1000 BC in Scandinavia, Ragnarok was interrupted due to [[Surtr (fate)|]] devouring Fenrir, causing him to gain Fenrir's authority and bringing an immature Twilight to the world. After he was defeated, with Ragnarok being unfinished the world is now forcibly ravaged by fire and ice for 3 millennia.

Released on the Japanese server on July 18, 2018 and on the NA server on June 23, 2020.

h4. Characters

title: solomon_(singularity)_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Final Singularity: The Grand Temple of Time, Solomon[/b]
[quote]
With the seven Singularities repaired, the final battleground awaits in a Singularity that exists outside human history.
Your foes: the 72 Demon Gods who protect the throne of the Mage King Solomon.
The ultimate battle for humanity's future is about to begin!
[/quote]
The final singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Set in the year 2016 in [[Grand Caster (fate)|Solomon]]'s temple, it serves as a grand finale to the first arc, with the [[absolutely everyone|majority of servants]] joining in the fight.

Released on the Japanese server on December 22, 2016 and on the NA server on December 20, 2018. It was adapted into a movie by [[Cloverworks]], [i]Fate/Grand Order: Final Singularity - The Grand Temple of Time: Solomon[/i].

title: da_vinci_to_shichinin_no_gansaku_eirei
body:
[b]Da Vinci and the 7 Counterfeit Heroic Spirits[/b]
[quote]Counterfeit Mona Lisas are flooding Chaldea!
An unprecedented crisis for the Da Vinci Workshop – nay, the world!
Rayshift alongside Da Vinci—
But is what awaits original, or a forgery?
This is a journey to find something real. All aboard!
[/quote]

title: big_smoke
body:
Melvin Harris, or more infamously known as [b]Big Smoke[/b], is a main character [spoilers]and secondary antagonist[/spoilers] in [[Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas]].

He is [[fat]], but says big boned to himself, and wears a black [[bowler hat]] along with a green shirt to represent Grove Street.

Beyond the game, he's known for several famous scenes which later became a [[meme]]:
* Him almost assaulting Carl Johnson: "You picked the wrong house, fool!"
* [[big smoke's order (meme)|His big order of food]] during the mission "Drive Thru".
* The infamous line "All we had to do is follow the damn train, CJ!" when failing the mission "Wrong Side of the Tracks".

title: buruma
body:
A type of [[underwear]]-like gym shorts, typically worn as part of a [[gym uniform]] with a [[gym shirt]].

"Buruma" is an English-to-Japanese-to-English transliteration of the word "bloomer", usually identifying an over-panty or public garment, whose purpose is to cover the panty and crotch area while leaving the maximum maneuvering room.

In real life, buruma are rarely part of a [[gym uniform]] these days since they're considered old-fashioned; however, they still show up in anime since they are fetishized by otaku.  

The buruma has become a feature internationally in women's [[track and field]] and other sports uniforms. Though the design and materials may be different, the "racing buruma" as they are known in Japan, serve the same purpose and have the same brief shape. 

Contrast with [[bloomers]], which are a type of underwear constructed much like boxer shorts worn by women.

h4. See also

* [[gym uniform]]
* [[bloomers]]
* [[dolphin shorts]]
* [[short shorts]]
* [[sports bikini]]
* [[track uniform]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Buruma":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/buruma]

title: tank_turret
body:
A type of turret designed to be mounted on a ground [[military vehicle]], often but not exclusively a [[tank]].

Tank turrets are generally compact and low profile, smaller than naval turrets, typically seating one to three crew members. The single main [[gun]] or [[cannon]] is usually centrally-mounted and of small or medium-caliber, often 20-125mm. May also feature additional coaxial or top-mounted armament,  mostly [[machine gun]]s but occasionally smaller cannons. Tank turrets are usually fully enclosed and designed to withstand hits from anti-tank cannons and/or missiles, but can be lightly armored, open topped, or open on one or more sides. Often features a [[tank cupola|cupola]], other observation devices, and [[hatch]]es. 

This tag can be applied when only the turret is present or visible, without the rest of the vehicle, and/or when a [[mecha]], [[personification]], or other character wears or uses a tank turret as a weapon.

[b]Do not[/b] use this tag for posts only featuring a [[tank cupola|cupola]] or [[hatch]], only use if the turret structure is visible. 

h4. Examples

* !post #6759248: Typical modern turret with characters sitting in cupolas and hatches, and a top-mounted machine gun.
* !post #4989651: Though not very low profile, this is still a tank turret.
* !post #2360571: This post contains a turret and hatches, but not the whole tank.
* !post #3736935: Similarly, turrets used or worn by personifications count.
* !post #3804177

h4. See also
* [[manually-operated mounted gun]]
* [[armored vehicle]]
* [[list of ground vehicles]]

title: racing_miku
body:
An alternate version of [[Hatsune Miku]] that serves as the mascot for [[GoodSmile Racing]].

[[Hatsune Miku]] receives a new design in a [[race queen]] theme for each racing season since 2009. The designs are officially acknowledged as "Racing Miku" (レーシングミク). The real life race queens for GoodSmile are known as the "Racing Miku Supporters" and wear outfits based on the Racing Miku design of the year.

The 2009 derivative is the only version of the Racing Miku derivatives which did not have an official illustration as per her release, though it was featured in merchandise for that season and new official arts have been given later on. The unveiling of the Racing Miku derivatives only became a feature from the 2010 season onwards. All merchandise related to Good Smile Racing featuring Miku prior to the 2010 season, with the exception of the 2009 Racing Miku figurine, features Miku in her normal attire.

title: viewfinder
body:
A camera frame. A set of lines in the corners of an image, used by a camera to frame a person being photographed.

In fanart, camera frames are usually used to indicate the person is being photographed or video recorded. If there is a red ' ●REC ' or similar icon in the corner, add the [[recording]] tag too.

Camera frames are usually used by older [[camera]]s and [[camcorder]]s, that had a separate physical viewfinder for the eye. They're less common in modern smartphones.

h4. See also
* [[Different viewfinder]]
* [[Facial recognition]]
* [[Fake phone screenshot]]
* [[Finger frame]]
* [[Picture frame]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Viewfinder":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viewfinder]

h4.Tagged Costumes

This section is an alphabetical listing of Sakura's tagged official costumes, primarily those seen in both the 90s anime and in Clear Card Arc. They will be separated between the two series as well. The names are derived from fan names listed on the "Cardcaptor Sakura wiki":https://ccsakura.fandom.com/wiki/List_of_Clothes_and_Costumes, since the series does not attribute official names for them. These chartags exist to make it more practical to search for a particular costume. Each of their wikis will detail when each costume is worn in the anime or manga, and what occurs during each instance.

Note that not every single one of Sakura's costumes are given chartags, particularly those only seen on manga covers. To search for those, use the {{kinomoto_sakura official_alternate_costume}} tags.

[[Megurine Luka]]'s updated voicebank and design for the [[vocaloid|VOCALOID4]] engine, official titled [[V4X]].

Her design was illustrated by [[iXima]] and, unlike the other [[V4X]] designs, is quite different from her original design. She wears a [[strapless shirt]] and long [[black skirt]] with [[black thighhighs]]. She has [[armbands]] with wide edges and [[bangles]] with see-through displays attached. Her [[headphones]] are more pronounced and her clothes have a [[gold trim]].

title: margherita_pizza
body:
A typical Neapolitan [[pizza]], made with [[tomato|tomatoes]], mozzarella [[cheese]], fresh [[basil leaf|basil]], salt, and [[olive oil]].

Allegedly, the name of the pizza was named in honor of Queen Margherita of Italy (9 January 1878 – 29 July 1900) in 1889 by Italian Chef Raffaele Esposito.

h4. Examples

* !post #8342868
* !post #7185450

h4.See also

* [[Chicago Deep Dish pizza]]
* [[Hawaiian pizza]]
* [[Pineapple on pizza]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: guapi_mao
body:
Literally "melon rind hat", a traditional Chinese hat created in the Qing dynasty. It's a round and brimless skullcap, sometimes striped, and sometimes adorned with a tassel.

body:

title: vostroyan_firstborns
body:
[[Astra Militarum]] military faction in [[Warhammer 40K]]. Hailing from the planet Vostroya, the Firstborn are raised from the collected first-born sons (and now, daughters) of every Vostroyan family, no matter their status. They specialize in urban and winter warfare. The Firstborn are based visually on the real-world Russian Cossacks and the Tsarist Russian Army, as opposed to the [[Valhallan Ice Warriors]], which are based on the Soviet Red Army. 

h4. External links
* https://wh40k.lexicanum.com/wiki/Vostroyan_Firstborn

title: roan_(ragnarok_the_animation)
body: Protagonist of [i][[Ragnarok the Animation]][/i].

title: valhallan_ice_warriors
body:
[[Astra Militarum]] military faction in [[Warhammer 40K]]. Valhallan Ice Warriors are known for their ferocity and determination even in the face of overwhelming odds and extreme losses, and are experts at winter, mountain, attritional, and anti-Ork warfare. Famously, Hero [[Commissar]] Ciaphas Cain began his career alongside Valhallan units. Visually, the Valhallan Ice Warriors are based off the Soviet Union's Red Army, as opposed to the [[Vostroyan Firstborns]], which are based off the Russian Cossacks and Tsarist era. 

h4. External links
* https://wh40k.lexicanum.com/wiki/Valhallan_Ice_Warriors

title: decorating_christmas_tree
body: Decorating a [[Christmas tree]] with decorations like [[Christmas ornaments]], [[Christmas lights]], and [[garland (decoration)|]].

title: armageddon_steel_legion
body:
[[Astra Militarum]] military faction in [[Warhammer 40K]]. Hailing from the highly industrialized Hive Planet of Armageddon, the Steel Legion are heavily mechanized, but unusually not due to a partnership with the Mechanicus. They have been heavily engaged against Orks since the arrival of a large Waagh against their planet, and have become very skilled in fighting against them. Visually, they tend to resemble World War Two era motorized forces. 

h4. External links
https://wh40k.lexicanum.com/wiki/Armageddon_Steel_Legion

The 2nd/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Kobo Kanaeru]].

She wears a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[white kimono]], [[white socks]] and [[white footwear|white sneakers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[long hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[double bun|double hair buns]].

title: pavolia_reine_(new_year)
body:
The 4th/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Pavolia Reine]].

It consists of a [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[black hat|black]] [[beret]] with a [[black veil]], a [[black choker|black]] triangular [[o-ring choker]], a [[yellow kimono|yellow]] [[lace-trimmed kimono|lace-trimmed]] [[furisode]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]], a black [[feather boa]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[low twintails|low]] [[low twin braids|twin braids]] with [[choppy bangs|choppy]] [[center-flap bangs]]. She also has [[black hair|black]] [[colored tips]] now.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6087624: Profile

title: kuroyoru_umidori
body:
Character from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]]. She likes [[stuffed dolphin]]s. Has a comical rivalry with [[Kinuhata Saiai]] and is often the target of [[Misaka Worst]]'s pranks.

She has [[black eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[sidelocks]] that transition to [[blonde hair|blonde]].  She typically wears a [[white coat|white]] [[hood]]ed [[trench coat]] on her [[coat on head|head]] with the [[hood up]] and her arms out of the sleeves, a [[black shirt|black]] and [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]] that leaves her [[bare shoulders|shoulders]], [[midriff]], and [[navel]] bare.  She wears [[black pants|black]] [[lowleg pants]], and [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow-length]] [[bridal gauntlets]], as well as [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. The sides of her top and gloves, and inner pant legs feature [[lace-up|laces]].

She has the ability to equip a [[mechanical arms|large number of robotic hands]] and use them to fire lances of nitrogen.

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Kuroyoru Umidori":[https://toarumajutsunoindex.fandom.com/wiki/Kuroyoru_Umidori]

title: sonoda_umi
body:
A character in [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]. One of the members of μ's. She is a member of the [[kyuudou]] club, as well as a member of the the μ's sub-unit [[lily white (love live!)|lily white]] (alongside [[Hoshizora Rin]] and [[Tojo Nozomi]]).

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. [[Kosaka Honoka]] and [[Minami Kotori]] are her childhood friends. 

Voiced by [[Mimori Suzuko]] (JPN), [[Kira Buckland]] (ENG).

title: osawa_rurino
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Mira-Cra Park!]] from the 103rd class. She may seem like an energetic party girl at first, but when she runs out of energy, she goes into what she calls a "dead battery" state. She is childhood friends with [[Fujishima Megumi]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[blonde hair|blonde]]-to-[[blue hair]]. Her hair is typically put up in [[twintails]] and prominently [[parted bangs]], with a pair of [[white flower|white]] and [[pink flower|pink]] [[hair flower|hair flowers]]. She is often depicted with a single [[fang]].

Voiced by [[Kan Kanna]].

h4. Appearance

title: tokoyami_towa_(school_uniform)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokoyami Towa]], as seen in "Rurudo's official design link":[https://twitter.com/rurudo_/status/1550105403455053824] (ex. post #5565174).

It is a black [[school uniform]], consisting of a [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[blazer]] with [[sleeve cuffs]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[purple necktie|purple]] [[short necktie]], an [[underbust]] [[black corset]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with a solid black front and [[plaid skirt|plaid]] sides, [[black socks|black]] [[pinstripe socks]], and [[black footwear]] [[loafers]]. She now also has [[black horns|black]] [[demon horns]] and [[demon wings|wings]] to emphasize her "devilish" character.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Long hair]] done in [[low twintails|low]] [[low twin braids|twin braids]]
* Long hair tied in a [[drill ponytail|drill]] [[side ponytail]]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24481623: Profile

title: miteiru_(shirakami_fubuki)
body:
A channel mascot of [[hololive]]'s [[Shirakami Fubuki]], originally introduced as a generic "stare" emote for her chat in October 2020, hence its name. Designed by Fubuki herself, as seen on "twitter":[https://twitter.com/shirakamifubuki/status/1315217059257622530]

It's depicted as a blob [[creature]] styled after a [[fox]] with [[solid eyes]] and wearing the same [[blue bowtie]] as [[shirakami fubuki (aristocrat kei)|Fubuki's 6th outfit]], according to Fubuki it can stick to any surface, stretch into any shape and never blinks.

h4. Appearence
* !post #8692714: Original design

h4. See also
* [[List of hololive mascots]]

title: ryuuhou_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Ryuuhou[/i]. Character designed by [[Tony Taka]]. 
First introduced in the [i]Swirling Cherry Blossoms[/i] event in December 2019 (one of her skills lends its name to the event).

In her base form, she is shown wearing a black [[double-breasted]] [[military uniform]] with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] orange print [[haori]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]] and [[bangs]] swept to her right, [[large breasts]], and [[pink horns]].

She is also shown with a [[katana]]-[[wakizashi]] [i]daishou[/i] pair attached to her [[belt]]. Her way to launch aircraft is via [[ofuda]] talismans, similar in principle to an [[onmyouji]].

h4. Skins

* !post #3729037: Default
* !post #6309339:  [[Ryuuhou (Firebird's New Year Dance) (azur lane)|Firebird's New Year Dance]]
* !post #5910165:  [[Ryuuhou (Queen of Whales) (Azur Lane)|Queen of Whales]] (unreleased)

h4. See also
* [[Ryuuhou (Kancolle)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Ryuuhou[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Ry%C5%ABh%C5%8D]

title: oruyanke_(shirakami_fubuki)
body:
[[Shirakami Fubuki]]'s channel [[mascot]]. It's a [[bamboo shoot]] creature with Fubuki's [[animal_ears|ears]] and [[tail]]. It speaks like a laid-back Fubuki.

It's name means "It's there, isn't it?" in Osaka dialect and likely follows Fubuki's frequent usage of "X-yanke" ("It's X, isn't it?").

h4. Appearance

* !post #4119284: oruyanke (left)

title: fubuzilla_(shirakami_fubuki)
body: [[Shirakami Fubuki]]'s form as a [[chibi]] [[kaiju]] in a [i]Holo no Graffiti[/i] short. Fubzilla is her official English name according to official YouTube subtitle translations. Her Japanese name is Fubura, similar to Godzilla's Japanese name Gojira. She's often used as a sort of alternative mascot for Fubuki, thanks to her plush-like proportions. In fact, she is just as often depicted as plush-sized than kaijuu-sized. h4. Appearance * !post #4243974: Big Fubuzilla at the center h4. External link * [Anime] How to Invoke a Kaiju - YouTube

title: royal_fortune_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the fourth sailing frigate named [i]Royal Fortune[/i], under the command of the Welsh pirate [[Bartholomew Roberts (fate)|]]. She is the first sailing ship in Azur Lane, and currently the second oldest ship depicted in-game.

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is piratical in theme, consisting of a [[torn clothes|torn]] [[white dress]], [[red skirt]], [[pirate hat]], [[black jacket]], [[pantyhose]], and black [[boots]], with a [[sword]] slung to her left side. 

h4. History
Originally the sailing frigate [i]Onslow[/i], she was captured by Roberts on 8 August 1721 and renamed in honor of three previous raiders named the [i]Royal Fortune[/i], and this was the ship under Roberts' command when he was killed in action on 10 February 1722 off the African coast by a [[Royal Navy]] ship.

title: primarch
body:
Major characters in the [[Warhammer 40k]] setting, the Primarchs were 20 beings created from scratch by the [[Emperor of Mankind]] and whose genes would be used as the basis for the biological modifications given to each legion of [[adeptus astartes|Space Marines]]. [spoiler]Many would die or vanish following the treason of one of their own, Horus, and the subsequent civil war. Meanwhile, Robute Guilliman, Primarch of the [[Ultramarines]], would return to the setting and become one of its principal characters.[/spoiler] h4. List of primarchs. Note [[Alpharius Omegon]] was split into "demi primarchs" [[Alpharius]] and [[Omegon]]. In universe the II'th and XI'th Legion were censured for unknown reasons with some fans creating their own concepts. Fan made interpretations are [[Lost Primarch]]s.

title: ranger_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the US Navy (light) aircraft carrier, USS [i]Ranger[/i] (CV-4), in [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[Enka (bcat)]], voiced by [[Asakawa Yuu]].

h4. Description
h5. Base Art

Ranger has long reddish-[[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a white [[tank top]] with reddish-[[pink skirt|pink]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with a horizontal white stripe around it with "RNGR" on her left, a reference to her real-life pre-war identification marks. She has a [[black jacket]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]], and [[black thighhighs]]. In addition, she wears
[[pink_gloves|pink]], [[partially fingerless gloves]], [[elbow gloves]] where the index finger is full covered, the middle finger is covered up to the first digit from the knuckle, and the ring and pinkie fingers are uncovered. She also has a [[headset]] with a [[microphone]] on her left side, a [[blue_bag|blue]] [[messenger bag]], and a [[choker]] with an [[anchor]] hanging from the front. She has very [[large breasts]] that sometimes get made bigger in what fanart she gets.

Her [[rigging]] is her ship model turned into a large [[crossbow]]-styled launcher. It is about 3/4 of her height, with a trigger about mid-ship on port-side. Her island superstructure is featured, alongside anti-air batteries, and a [[radar dish]]. She has a [[badge]] on her bag, which is her real life crew's badge.

h5. Retrofit Art
[tn]See post #2930385[/tn]

In her [[retrofit (azur lane)|]], her outfit gets swapped for white [[front-tie top]], a pair of [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical]] [[tight pants]] where the left leg is wrapped with black leather strips, and a jacket-esque [[cape]]. She sports a new [[flat cap]] with a white top and red beak, and some [[armored boots]].  Her already [[large breasts]] get more emphasize if not an actual increase.

Her rigging loses the crossbow aesthetic and moves the trigger and handle aft.

h5. Personality and In-game Trivia
Ranger takes on a role of a teacher, similar to [[Langley (Azur Lane)|]], treating the Commander as one of her students. She gets easily flustered, stuttering and getting embarrassed in several of her lines, with a number of things suggesting some desire for her students.

Her plane loadout is purely dive bombers (like her real-life counterpart). Her skillset is particularly RNG dependent, leading to potentially hilarious damage output.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Ranger[/i] was the US Navy's first carrier designed and built from scratch, providing valuable training experience to Naval aviators for the likelihood of war. In World War II, she primarily saw combat in the Atlantic and Mediterranean theaters as her comparatively slow speed, minimal armor, and limited plane capacity prevented her from seeing service in the Pacific other than training duties from 1944 onward. She was decommissioned in 1946 and sold for scrap a year later.

title: black_legion
body:
The [b]Black Legion[/b] is the largest warband of [[Chaos Space Marine]]s in [[Warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40k]] universe. [spoiler]Formed after the defeat of the [[sons_of_horus|Sons of Horus]] in the Horus Heresy and their retreat in the Eye of Terror, [/spoiler]the Legion was founded by [spoiler]former Sons of Horus First Captain [/spoiler][[Abbadon_the_Despoiler|Abbadon the Despoiler]] during the feuds among traitor legions known as the Legion Wars. It includes a substantial portion of the former [spoiler]Sons of Horus [/spoiler]alongside some [[Space_Marine|Space Marines]] from other traitor legions. The Black Legion sees itself [spoiler]not as the successor of [[Horus_Lupercal|Horus]] and his Legion, but [/spoiler]as a new army to continue the Long War against the [[Imperium_of_man|Imperium]] and succeed where their predecessors failed.
The warriors of the legion wear [[black_armor|black]] [[power_armor|power armor]], decorated with [[gold]] and [[Chaos_Undivided_(symbol)|symbols]] of the [[Chaos_Undivided|Chaos Undivided]] they worship.

title: luna_wolves
body:
The [b]Luna Wolves[/b] were the XVIth [[Space_Marine|Space Marine]] Legion raised by the [[Emperor_of_Mankind|Emperor of Mankind]] in [[Warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40k]]. Founded on Terra ([[Earth_(planet)|Earth]]) at the dawn of the Great Crusade in the late 30th Millennium. After the Emperor rediscovered the Legion's [[primarch]] [[Horus_Lupercal|Horus]] in 801.M30 on the world of Cthonia, and gave him command of the Luna Wolves, Horus went on to lead the XVIth Legion in earning thousands of battle honours over the span of the 200 standard years of the Great Crusade.
Primarch renamed the legion from the Luna Wolves to the [[Sons_of_Horus|Sons of Horus]][spoiler] shortly before his fall into [[Chaos_(Warhammer)|Chaos]] and the start of the Heresy[/spoiler]. 
The Luna Wolves wore [[White_armor|white]] [[power_armor|power armour]], a [[roman_empire|Roman-inspired]] centurion helmet and the legion's symbol of a [[wolf]]'s head with a [[crescent moon]] (commemorates the conquest of the [[Moon]], the campaign that gave the legion its name). After reuniting with their Primarch, they also added his [[eyes_of_horus_(warhammer_40k)|eye symbol]] on their armour.

title: prinz_heinrich_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the P-class heavy cruiser [i]Prinz Heinrich[/i]. Character design by [[Dishwasher1910]], voiced by Nitta Hiyori.

h4. Personality
An excitable girl prone to air-headedness, Prinz Heinrich often boasts of her strength while having difficulty grasping the necessity of tactical skill. She has also named her rigging "Eisen", and treats it much the same way one would a beloved dog, reflective of one of her in-game skills.

h4. Appearance

Like other Ironblood ships, Prinz Heinrich has a general red-white-black color theme, with  [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[white hair]] tied into a low braid framing [[red eyes]] and adorned by a black [[hair ribbon]]. Her outfit consists of a [[crop top]] with [[detached sleeves]] that exposes a [[large_breasts|significant amount]] of [[underboob]]. Covering her waist is a black jacket with a red anchor ornament and a [[pleated skirt]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of all her four 283 mm mounts (two triple, two twin) in an animalistic rig that she refers to as "Eisen".

title: anti-chan_(nuelogical)
body:
A derivative of [[orenjipiiru]]'s original character "[[Child GF (orenji)|]]". She originates from user "notsleepypilled":[https://twitter.com/intent/user?user_id=1734075015157702656]'s attempt to repurpose [[nuelogical]]'s design of Child GF (post #7496962) into a character that made fun of Lolicon types, which instead had the opposite effect with [[anti-chan (nuelogical)|]] adopting a [[mesugaki]] personality and becoming a mockery of those who are critical of Lolicon instead.

In contrast with orenji's original design, she wears a [[blue shirt]] (often a [[print shirt]] with the words "KYS" or "NO UOH!"), and a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[sun hat]] with a [[blue bow]] representing the colors of the [[crying emoji]] which is strongly associated with the [[uohhhhhhhhh! (meme)|]] meme.

title: prince_of_wales_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the second [i]King George V[/i]-class battleship, HMS [i]Prince of Wales[/i] (53). 
Character design by [[Enka (bcat)|]], voiced by [[Hashimoto Chinami (voice Actor)|]].

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] tied to a [[french braid]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her outfit is virtually identical to her older sister [[King George V (Azur Lane)|]]: [[red cape]] with [[fur trim]], [[red jacket]], [[white shirt|white]] [[double-breasted]] [[shirt]], and a [[saber (weapon)|]] as melee sidearm. She differs in that she also has an [[aiguillette]], her [[thighhighs]] are [[white thighhighs|white]] instead of black, has no garter straps, and wears a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]] instead of white. 

Her [[rigging]] is also the same as her sister (three 356 mm main gun mounts and two 133 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]]) but her right side gun contains her real-life ship's badge.

title: tokoyami_towa_(jirai_kei)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokoyami Towa]], as seen in "Rurudo's official":[https://hololive.wiki/wiki/File:Tokoyami_Towa_-_Full_Illustration_04-1.jpg] "designs":[https://hololive.wiki/wiki/File:Tokoyami_Towa_-_Full_Illustration_04-2.jpg] (ex. post #4507970).

Her third costume is [i][[jirai kei]][/i]-themed and consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[horned headwear|horned]] [[beret]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[collared shirt]] with [[short sleeves|short]] [[frilled sleeves]], a [[black bowtie]] with a [[pom pom (clothes)|]], an [[open cardigan|open]] [[grey cardigan|grey]] [[aran sweater]] with [[cross-laced sleeves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[miniskirt]], a [[heart o-ring|heart]] [[o-ring thigh strap]], [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[shoes]]. She also has a [[leg tattoo]], [[heart earrings]] with [[cross earrings|crosses]], and an [[ear chain]] in addition to her usual ear piercings.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this costume:

* [[Long hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and a [[side_braid]] ending in a [[one side up]] with a [[single side bun|single]] [[side up bun]], held with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]]

title: portland_(azur_lane)
body:
Azur Lane's personification of the American heavy cruiser [i]Portland[/i], drawn by [[Saru]]. Her younger [[sisters|sister]] is [[Indianapolis_(azur_lane)|]].

Portland's appearance consists of light [[purple hair]] done in a [[side ponytail]] and sporting a [[heart ahoge]], [[blue eyes]] with [[heart-shaped pupils]], a [[skin fang]], and [[large_breasts|large breasts]]. She wears a [[black bikini]] [[bikini top only|top]] showing [[cleavage]] and an [[off shoulder]] [[blue shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]]. She also wears a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]] with [[uneven legwear]], usually a [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] and a [[white socks|white sock]] with [[grey footwear|grey]] [[shoes]]. 

The most distinctive part of her, however, is her personality. Portland displays intensive [[siscon]]/[[incest]] tendencies towards [[indianapolis_(azur_lane)|Indianapolis]], referring to her in virtually every single line she has. In addition, she is shown holding multiple doujinshi of her beloved "Indy-chan". She likely outdoes Kantai Collection's [[ooi (kancolle)|Ooi]] in terms of obsessiveness over her sister ship.

For her retrofit form, see her [[Portland (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

title: indianapolis_(azur_lane)
body:
The "USS [i]Indianapolis[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Indianapolis (CA-35) as personified and portrayed in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Her older [[sisters|sister]] is [[Portland (azur lane)|]].

She was designed by [[Saru]] and is voiced by Yokota Aya.

As with the other shipgirls who bear the namesake with Native American-related places, she is a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] girl with [[very long hair|very long]] light [[pink hair|pink]] [[twintails]] with a [[heart ahoge]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] eyes - the left [[yellow eyes|yellow]], the right [[blue eyes|blue]]. She has [[facepaint]] underneath her eyes and her [[covered mouth|mouth is covered]] by a metallic [[turtleneck]]. Her attire is comprised of [[white thighhighs|white]] [[uneven legwear]], a white [[underboob]]-exposing [[white bandeau|bandeau]], [[partially fingerless gloves|partly fingerless]] [[black gloves]], [[mechanical horns]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] takes shape as two gigantic [[mechanical arms]] mounted on her upper back.

She most notably sits on top of the [[Fat Man (bomb)|]] [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]], in reference to how she was used to transport the component of the Fat Man in real life. Eventually the [[radiation symbol]] on her nuke was replaced with a cutesy devil face for untranslated reasons even though both the Japanese and Chinese playerbase took no offense to its presence and even seemed to resent the change.

title: pompeo_magno_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Capitani Romani (Roman Captain)-class light cruiser/destroyer [i]Pompeo Magno[/i] in [[Azur Lane]].

Historically commissioned under the Roman Captain name as a light cruiser in 1943, she was surrendered to the Allies just three months later in the Armistice of Cassibile.
Post-war, she and one of her sisters ([i]Giulio Germanico[/i]) were retained by the new Italian Navy and underwent a reconstruction program that saw them reclassed as destroyer leaders and refitted with a weapons suite similar to [[Allen M. Sumner (Azur Lane)|]] and her sisters (namely, three twin 127 mm mounts albeit hers was two mounts aft while Sumner's was two mounts fore). In addition, she was renamed [i]San Giorgio[/i] (pennant D562).

Named after the Roman general Pompey the Great.

title: kinki_no_magna
body:
[i]Forbidden Magna[/i]

A strategy RPG that released in 2014 exclusively for the [[nintendo_3ds|Nintendo 3DS]]. Called "Lord of Magna: Maiden Heaven" internationally.

It's development was originally started by Neverland, the studio behind the [[rune_factory|Rune Factory]] series, but the game's development was ultimately finished by [[marvelous|Marvelous]] following Neverland's bankrupcy in 2013.

title: peter_strasser_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the second [i]Graf Zeppelin[/i]-class aircraft carrier, named in honor of the [[Imperial German Navy]]'s commander of the airship fleet in [[World War I]]. Character design by [[Gujianshaonu]], voiced by [[Hara Yumi]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] tied in [[twintails]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a white [[peaked cap]], a [[double-breasted]] two-tone [[military uniform]] with a long black strap, [[white gloves]], and [[high heels]].

As for her [[rigging]], she combines the animalistic sentient rig style of the Ironblood faction with the split-deck design of the [[Essex (Azur Lane)|]]-class. It is also themed like clockwork, as she stands on a floating clock and has red-colored gears surrounding her, which leads players to note similarities with [[Tokisaki Kurumi]] down to her own hairstyle.

In real life, [i]Peter Strasser[/i] was built in 1938 but work stopped in September 1939 in order to prioritize construction of U-boats and never resumed, ultimately being scrapped on the slipway the following year. In any case, her intended flight deck arresting gear and catapults ended up being purchased by the [[Regia Marina]] to complete [[Aquila (Azur Lane)|]].

title: sons_of_horus
body:
The [b]Sons of Horus[/b] is the XVIth Legion of [[Space_Marine|Space Marines]] in [[Warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40k]], was originally known as the [[Luna_Wolves|Luna Wolves]]. In honour of their [[Primarch]] [[Horus_Lupercal|Horus]]' great achievements during Great Crusade, after the Ullanor triumph his father, the [[Emperor_of_Mankind|Emperor of Mankind]] suggested that the Legion be renamed the "Sons of Horus" and the Primarch, at his brother [[Sanguinius]]' urging, did it some time later. 
[spoiler]Shortly after the Legion's renaming, Horus was corrupted by the [[Chaos_(Warhammer)|Chaos Gods]] and started a rebellion against his father known as the Horus Heresy. At the start of the Heresy, one third of the loyal to the [[Imperium_of_Man|Imperium]] Sons of Horus were killed during the lstvaan III massacre, the remainder supported the Primarch in his war against the Emperor, and become the [[Chaos_Space_Marine|Chaos_Space_Marines]][/spoiler]
[spoiler]After their defeat at the Battle of Terra, the Sons of Horus escaped with the other Traitor Legions into the Eye of Terror, where they fell apart to many warbands until the Legion's First Captain [[Abbadon_the_Despoiler|Ezekyle Abaddon]] united most of them into the [[Black_Legion|Black Legion]].[/spoiler]
The Sons of Horus wore [[Green_armor|green]] or [[Black_armor|black]] [[power_armor|power armor]], [[pickelhaube|spiked helmets]] and their Primarch's [[eyes_of_horus_(warhammer_40k)|eye symbol]].

title: hekapoo
body:
[b]Hekapoo[/b] is a character who appears in the [[Disney]] animated series [[Star vs the Forces of Evil]]. She is the forger of Dimensional Scissors and one of the members of the Magic High Commission. She is voiced by "Zosia Mamet":[https://starvstheforcesofevil.fandom.com/wiki/Zosia_Mamet].

Hekapoo has pale [[white skin]], [[spiked arm]]s, [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] (tied back in a black spiky [[hair tie]]) with bangs that cover her right eye, [[orange eyes]], [[fangs]], [[pointy ears|pointed ears]], and yellow-orange [[horns]]. She primarily wears a yellow-orange ballgown, brown [[high heel boots]], and a [[black tiara|black]] [[tiara]]. A small orange flame constantly burns over her head.

title: satsuki_yomi
body:
Character in [[Toji no Miko]]. One of four [[origami yukari|Yukari's]] bodyguards. An expresionless girl that can't used a katana properly, making her willing to do anything to obtain power. [spoiler]Her body has been injected with Noro to making her powerful, thus making her original black hair turned white. With that, she use a unique fighting style which requires her to injure herself in order to produce a small pack of [[aratama (toji no miko)|Aratama]] that fights for her. After injecting too much Noro as a way to fight against [[kohagura ellen|Ellen]] and [[mashiko kaoru|Kaoru]] in episode 11, she collapsed and later deceased[/spoiler]. Voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]].

She has a [[medium hair|medium]] [[white hair|white]]/[[grey hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[colored tips|tip]] styled in [[bob cut]] and a [[brown eyes]]. Her katana is Suijingiri Kanemitsu and she use Shinjin-ryu as her fighting style.

body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the XVIth [[adeptus_astartes|Legiones Astartes]], the [[Sons_of_Horus|Sons of Horus]] (originally known as the [[Luna_Wolves|Luna Wolves]]).
[spoiler]Corrupted by the [[Chaos_(warhammer)|Chaos forces]], he betrayed his father, the [[Emperor_of_Mankind|Emperor of Mankind]], and started a devastating civil war within the [[Imperium_of_Man|Imperium of Man]] known as the Horus Heresy.[/spoiler]
[quote]
By the time of the Heresy, Horus was equipped with the gigantic Power Maul [[Worldbreaker (warhammer 40k)|]], said to be constructed by the Emperor's own hands. His right arm wielded the Talon of Horus, a monstrous [[clawed gauntlets|Power Claw]] constructed for him as a gift by the Dark Mechanicum's Fabricator-General Kelbor-Hal. Originally, he fought with a Power Sword and Twin-Linked Bolter.[16] Horus wore an enormous suit of Terminator [[power armor|Armour]] known as [[the Serpent's Scales (warhammer)|]].
[/quote]

title: yuffie_kisaragi
body:
Playable [[ninja]] thief from [[FINAL FANTASY VII]], featured in the Compilation ([i][[final fantasy vii advent children|AC]][/i], [i][[before crisis final fantasy vii|BC]][/i], [i][[crisis core final fantasy vii|CC]][/i], [i][[dirge of cerberus final fantasy vii|DoC]][/i]) and [[final fantasy vii remake|the remake]]. Also appears in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series.

Yuffie has [[short hair|short]], [[black hair]] and either [[brown eyes|brown]] or [[grey eyes]].  She wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[
green shirt|green]] [[sleeveless turtleneck]] with [[shoulder armor]] and a [[single sleeve|single]] [[yellow sleeves|yellow sleeve]] over her left arm, leaving the other [[single bare shoulder|shoulder bare]].  She wears either [[yellow shorts|yellow]] or [[grey shorts|grey]] [[open fly|unbuttoned]] [[short shorts]], and has [[asymmetrical legwear]] consisting of [[leg armor]] and a [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] on her left leg, and [[leg warmers]] on both legs.  She also wears a [[headband]], [[fishnet armwear]], [[orange gloves|orange]] [[fingerless gloves]] and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[sneakers]].  Generally depicted with [[small breasts|small]] to [[medium breasts]].

Yuffie wields a [[shuriken]] and is frequently in possession of [[materia]].

title: sousaphone
body:
A type of [[tuba]] with conical tubing that is widely used in [[marching band|marching bands]]. It is designed in a way that fits around the body of the tubist. While the valves are near chest level, the bell is above the player's head. It was developed in the 1890s by one J.W. Pepper at the request of John Philip Sousa (1854–1932), the legendary American marching band director and composer, who wanted a tuba that was easier and more comfortable to march with than the types then in common use.

h4. Examples
 
* !asset #23232311: "Source: Wikimedia":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Yamaha_Sousaphone_YSH-411.jpg]

title: boots
body:
A type of footwear characterized for their durability. They cover the entire foot as well as the ankle, or even more. They can be made from [[leather]], rubber, or even [[metal]]. Some have steel plating on the end to protect the toes.

Footwear that doesnt cover the whole foot (like [[mary janes]]), footwear that doesn't cover the ankle (like [[oxfords]]), footwear that are less durable (like [[high tops]]) are tagged as [[shoes]].  

So, while high tops cover the ankle, their comparative lack of durability classify them as shoes (most sneakers are made of textiles or soft plastic).

title: anica_domazet
body:
Anica Domazet (callsign "Thompson") is a female Croatian character, created in 2024 by LapisLumos and designed by [[Chen Feng (slbdofcl)|]].

She owes her callsign to the Croatian group "Thompson", and her first name to their song "Anica − Kninska kraljica".

She is [[Zarya Petrovic|Skorpion]]'s love interest.

title: darya_karamazova
body:
Darya Karamazova (callsign "Dasha") is a female Russian character, created by LapisLumos in 2024 and designed by [[Chen Feng (slbdofcl)|]].

She's a veteran of the First and Second Chechen Wars.

She was designed as the unofficial mother of [[Marichka]] to a Ukrainian father.

title: fusion_dance
body:
[i]Fuuuu...[/i]sion [b]HAAAAAAAA![/b]

A special technique in [[Dragon Ball]] where two beings of similar builds and power levels perform an awkward symmetrical dance that, when performed correctly, will result in [[fusion|a fused being]] typically more powerful than the two dancers. Though the fused being will be eventually de-fused and returned back to two individuals some time later.

The final pose of the dance shows both participants facing the same direction, a few feet apart, leaning towards each other with extended arms and index fingers meeting.

The form that manifests from the dance, if series-accurate, is seen wearing a [[Metamoran vest]], a black waistcoat-reminiscent vest with a yellow padding-like collar. 

h4. Example

* !post #983444

h4. See also

* [[Gogeta]]
* [[potara earrings]]
* [[fusion]]
* [[gattai]]

title: c_(programming_language)
body:
C is a general-purpose programming language that was designed with portability in mind. It has attained significant influence since its creation, spawning an entire family of languages inspired by its syntax.

It was created in the 1970s by Dennis Ritchie, and has since become one of the most popular languages. Today, it is still widely used for operating system kernels and device drivers.

Some of the languages it has inspired include [[C++ (programming_language)|]], [[Java (programming_language)|]], [[JavaScript]], [[c sharp (programming_language)|C#]], and [[PHP (programming_language)|]].

title: uwabaki
body:
Uwabaki(上履き, meaning 'indoor shoes') is the Japanese indoor [[shoes]] where outdoor shoes are prohibited, such as in schools, in gyms or some offices. 

Often considered as school indoor shoes made of white cloth and colored rubber often with a same-colored toe and shoe sole that sometimes indicates the grade, These are usually (but not always) in a style similar to [[mary janes]]. Students change their outdoor shoes into uwabaki at the [[getabako]]s when they enter the school.

Not to be confused with [[loafers]] which is worn quite often with school uniforms, but it is not indoor shoes.

h4. Examples

* !post #1536420
* !post #7095024

* !post #6584459: Left is [[mary janes]], right is uwabaki

title: clothes_focus
body:
Images focused on clothing or headwear, a subtype of [[object focus]]. Images usually have [[no humans]]. Some images may feature humans, but still focus on clothes by either doing [[close-up]]s of the garments/footwear or showing off various outfits, drawing the viewers attention mainly onto the clothes worn, rather than the wearer. The wearers [[head out of frame|head being out of frame]] can help to draw attention to the clothing.

If the focus is on shoes use [[footwear focus]] instead.
