title: mizukawa_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of Mizukawa Girls' High School, seen mainly in [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]. It is also worn by their middle school students.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a colored [[necktie]], a [[black sweater vest|black]] [[sweater vest]], an [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with an [[emblem]] on the wearer's left, and a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]. 

As [[Wien Margarete]] ([[Love Live! Superstar!!]]) wears a similar uniform, this may be used for her appearance in her middle school uniform as well.

title: fold-over_collar
body:
Any [[collar]] that overlaps one side over the other. Not to be confused with the  folded-down [[wing collar]].

This does not include traditional garments that have fold-over collars by default, as seen in clothing such as [[japanese clothes|Japanese]] [[kimono]]s, [[Chinese clothes|Chinese]] [[hanfu]], [[Korean clothes|Korean]] [[hanbok]] et cetera.

It may, however, be seen in garments that fuse elements of East Asian clothing with other fashion types, such as with [[wa lolita|wa]] and [[qi lolita]].

h4. Examples

title: hokuto_no_ken:_shinpan_no_sousousei_kengou_retsuden
body:
[b]Hokuto no Ken: Shinpan no Sousousei Kengo Retsuden[/b] ([b]北斗の拳 ～審判の双蒼星 拳豪列伝～[/b], literally [i]Fist of the North Star - Judgement of the Twin Blue Stars - Fighters Assemble[/i]), known in the west simply as [b][[hokuto no ken|Fist of the North Star]][/b], is a 2D competitive [[fighting game]] produced by [[Sega]] and developed by [[Arc System Works]], based on the manga series of the same name.

One of the most memorable and entertaining [i]kusoge[/i] ever made. Primarily due to each character featuring various bizarre and over-the-top movesets adapted from various part of the anime (such as [[Souther]] being able to drop the [[Seitei Jujiryou|Holy Cross pyramid]]'s apex stone at the opponent or [[Jagi]] can force the opponent to "[[Say my name|say his name]]"), along with every character being able to achieve infinite combo.

title: world_war_i
body:
[b]World War I[/b] (WWI), which was predominantly called the World War or [b]The Great War[/b] from its occurrence until 1939 ([[World War II]]), and the [b]First World War[/b] or World War I thereafter, was a major war centred in Europe. It began on 28 July 1914 when [[Austria]]-[[Hungary]] declared war against [[Serbia]] and lasted until 11 November 1918 after the [[German Empire]] and the Allies signed an armistice.

The geopolitical changes it generated in most of the world after its eventual outcome were a direct cause for [[World War II]] more than 20 years later.

World War I is notable for stalemate [[trench]] warfare on the western front, and the development and application of new technology in warfare such as [[tank|tanks]], [[airplane|airplanes]] and [[submarine|submarines]].

h4.Factions 

[b]The Allied Powers[/b] 
* [[United Kingdom|British Empire]] 
* [[France]] 
* [[Russian Empire]] (until 1917)
* [[Belgium]]
* [[Japan|Empire of Japan]] 
* [[Italy]] (1915-1918)
* [[United states|United States]]  (1917-1918)

[b]The Central Powers[/b] 
* [[German Empire]] 
* [[Austria|Austro]]-[[Hungary|Hungarian]] [[Austria-Hungary|Empire]]
* [[Ottoman Empire]] 
* [[Bulgaria]] (1915-1918)

h4. Some battles

* Western Front
** [[Battle of Jutland]]

* Asian and Pacific theatre
** [[Siege of Tsingtao]]

h4. World War I in Popular Culture
* [[All Quiet On The Western Front]]
* [[1917 (Film)]]
* [[Battlefield 1]]

h4. See Also

h4. External Links

title: world_war_ii
body:
[b]The Second World War[/b] (abbreviated "WWII" or "WW2") was a major worldwide [[war]] that was first set off by the [[second_sino-japanese_war|Japanese invasion of Manchuria]] and then officially began when [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] attacked [[Poland]] on September 1st of 1939 and ended after [[Japan]] surrendered on August 15th of 1945. It is considered a result of the outcome of [[World War I]].

The belligerents formed two major factions, the Allied Powers (or "Allies") and the Axis Powers (or "Axis").

World War II is considered the deadliest military conflict in human history. Over 60 million people died as a result of the fighting and/or resulting resource shortages, as well as deliberate mass killings throughout the war, and hundreds of millions were displaced or left destitute in the aftermath. WW2 can also be considered the deathblow to the old European empires which had dominated history up to that point; the war left them financially, militarily, and culturally even more exhausted than they had been after WW1 and saw the rise of two new super-powers with a rather anti-colonial bent to them: the [[soviet|USSR]] and the [[united states|USA]], thus kickstarting the [[Cold War]].

Technologically, WW2 saw the first usage of the many trends that still dominate warfare to this day: the first modern [[missile]]s and [[rocket]]s were used during WW2, [[aircraft carrier]]s replaced [[battleship]]s as the dominant surface warfare vessels, unmanned radio controlled vehicles saw limited use during the war, and [[StG 44]], the world's first assault rifle, entered service during the later half of the war. The most important and influential technology used, however, is the first (and only) usage of a [[nuclear weapon]] in the history of warfare: [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|when the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki were destroyed by the atomic bombs dropped by the USA]].

This tag can be applied if the image is related to World War 2, such as featuring technology (tanks, aircraft, warships or weapons) of the era, uniforms & troops, or battle scenes.

title: doolittle_raid
body:
An air raid campaign on 18 April 1942 conducted by the [[United States Navy]] against the Japanese capital of [[Tokyo]] during [[World War II]]. The raid was named after the then-lieutenant colonel [[Jimmy Doolittle]], who planned and led the operation. It served as an initial retaliation for the Attack on [[Pearl Harbor]] four months prior.

The raid was conducted using 16 [[B-25 Mitchell]] medium bombers launched from the [[aircraft carrier]] [[USS Hornet (CV-8)]]. The attack was conceived as a one-way trip, as the Mitchells would not be able to return to the USN carrier fleet to conceal their position and instead they will be landed in areas controlled by the [[Kuomintang]]-controlled [[China]] for extraction.

While the raid caused minimal damage to the Japanese, it provided significant moral and propaganda victory for the US, as the raid demonstrated that the Japanese home island is not safe from attack. This would ended up being one of the contributing factor for the Imperial Japanese Navy to attack the Midway island, resulting in the [[Battle of Midway]].

title: tamamo_nine
body:
In the [[fate (series)|Fate series]], [[Tamamo no Mae (fate/extra)|]] splits eight of her nine tails, and they each wind up gaining sentience and becoming Servants of their own. Each of them wears different colored kimono and has their own signature hairstyle. Aside from Tamamo no Mae herself, only two of the Tamamo Nine have been fully identified: [[Tamamo Cat (fate)|]], the Berserker-class Servant who wears red and represents the original's more pure and sincere aspects, and [[Tamamo Aria (fate)|]], the Rider-class Servant who wears yellow and mirrors what others expect of her. The remaining six have only been seen in asset #24474191, but some of their names and personalities have been revealed:

* Tamamo Vitch, the "talented beautiful secretary"
* Tamamo Gucchi, who likes expensive things
* Tamamo Delmo, the "supremacy of the home"
* Tamamo no Hime, the "noncommittal princess" 

This tag is for images containing any of the Tamamo Nine aside from the original Tamamo no Mae, Tamamo Cat, and Tamamo Aria, especially if their designs are from the sketch referenced above.

Note that due to certain circumstances in [[Fate/Grand Order]], [[Koyanskaya (fate)|]] is referred to as Tamamo Vitch, but this is actually false. For that reason, some images representing the pink-colored Tamamo may be of Koyanskaya, due to them being drawn before the events of the [[Tunguska Sanctuary (fate/grand order)|]] in FGO. (Koyanskaya can be distinguished by her [[animal ears]] being the same pink as her hair [spoiler]as a result of them actually being [[rabbit ears]][/spoiler] whereas the rest of the Tamamo Nine have orange [[fox ears]]. The tag may still apply if she's wearing the distinctive [[off shoulder]] kimono worn by all members of the Tamamo Nine.

body:

title: poptepipic
body:
[b]Poptepipic[/b], also known as [b]Pop Team Epic[/b], is a [[4koma]] comedy manga series by [[bkub]] about the surreal hijinks of the weirdo duo [[Popuko]] and [[Pipimi]]. Well known for heavy usage of [[middle finger]] and absurdly bizarre gags.

An anime adaption was announced, and later delayed, for January 2018, airing for the Q1 2018 season. It would be followed up by a double-length April Fools' special, and a second season.

title: navy_seal_copypasta_(meme)
body:
A notorious copypasta about a self-proclaimed "[[Navy SEALs|Navy SEAL]]" threatening an internet user with his supposed feats and connections.

[quote]What the fuck did you just fucking say about me, you little bitch? I'll have you know I graduated top of my class in the Navy Seals, and I've been involved in numerous secret raids on Al-Quaeda, and I have over 300 confirmed kills. I am trained in gorilla warfare and I'm the top sniper in the entire US armed forces. You are nothing to me but just another target. I will wipe you the fuck out with precision the likes of which has never been seen before on this Earth, mark my fucking words. You think you can get away with saying that shit to me over the Internet? Think again, fucker. As we speak I am contacting my secret network of spies across the USA and your IP is being traced right now so you better prepare for the storm, maggot. The storm that wipes out the pathetic little thing you call your life. You're fucking dead, kid. I can be anywhere, anytime, and I can kill you in over seven hundred ways, and that's just with my bare hands. Not only am I extensively trained in unarmed combat, but I have access to the entire arsenal of the United States Marine Corps and I will use it to its full extent to wipe your miserable ass off the face of the continent, you little shit. If only you could have known what unholy retribution your little "clever" comment was about to bring down upon you, maybe you would have held your fucking tongue. But you couldn't, you didn't, and now you're paying the price, you goddamn idiot. I will shit fury all over you and you will drown in it. You're fucking dead, kiddo.[/quote]

title: sleeves_past_fingers
body:
Sleeves that reach past the fingers, covering the entire hand. Even longer than [[sleeves past wrists]].

Usually a result of extremely baggy or [[oversized clothes]].

See [[sleeves past wrists]] for sleeves that cover the wrists, but not the whole hand. Usually, around mid-palm in length.

h4. Examples

* !post #8519549

h4. See also

* [[sleeves past wrists]]
* [[hands in opposite sleeves]]
* [[long sleeves]]
* [[oversized clothes]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Cute Oversized Sleeves":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/cuteoversizedsleeves

title: hand_drill
body:
A [[tools|tool]] used for boring holes in a material. Can be electrical or hand powered.

Not to be confused with [[drill hand]], which is when a character's hand is literally a drill.

title: saw
body:
A saw is a [[tools|tool]] consisting of a hard blade, wire, or chain with a toothed edge. It is used to cut through relatively hard material, most often wood. 
The cut is made by placing the toothed edge against the material and moving it forcefully back and forth.

h4. Types

* [[Hand saw]]
* [[Hacksaw]]
* [[Japanese saw]]
* [[Bonesaw]]
* [[Brushcutter]]
* [[Chainsaw]]
* [[Circular saw]]
* [[Coping saw]]
* [[Saw cleaver]]
* [[Two-man saw]]
* [[Saw Sawing]] outside of [[Tokyo Big Sight]]

title: facing_viewer
body:
A character facing the viewer but with their [[closed eyes|eyes closed]], [[covered eyes|covered]], or [[sideways_glance|looking in another direction]].

Don't confuse with [[looking at viewer]], which should be used when eyes are open and staring at the viewer.

h4. Examples
* !post #6085353
* !post #4351210
* !post #2598213

h4. See also

* [[straight-on]]
* [[facing away]]
* [[facing ahead]]
* [[looking at viewer]]

title: wrench
body:
A [[tools|tool]] used to apply leverage to tighten and loosen  [[nut (hardware)|]]s or  [[bolt (hardware)|]]s. Also called a spanner.

h4. Types

* [[adjustable wrench]]
* [[combination wrench]]
* [[double sided wrench]]
* [[pipe wrench]]
* [[socket wrench]]
* [[lug wrench]]

h4. See Also

* [[Tag group:Technology]]

title: yae_sakura
body:
A [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]/[[Benghuai Xueyuan]] character, [[Yae Rin]]'s older sister. Voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]] in Japanese. 

One of the [[Thirteen Flame-Chasers (honkai impact)|]], codenamed [b]Setsuna[/b]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[rabbit ears]] and [[purple eyes]].

h4. Appearance
h6. Only base Valkyria outfits are shown. Other costumes are indexed by Valkyria outfit.

* !post #2816460: [[yae_sakura_(gyakushinn_miko)|Gyakushinn Miko]]
* !post #4716894: [[yae_sakura_(goushinnso_memento)|Goushinnso Memento]]/Flame-Chaser [[yae sakura (goushinnso memento)|Sakura]]
* !post #3330783: [[yae_sakura_(flame_sakitama)|Flame Sakitama]]
* !post #3705986: [[Yae Kasumi]]

h4. See also

* [[Yae Miko]] - her [[Genshin Impact]] counterpart.

title: suenaga_mirai
body:
[quote]
[[Danny Choo]] said:

Mirai Suenaga (末永みらい) is the site [[mascot]] character for [[Culture Japan]] (dannychoo.com) who I developed with illustrator [[azami_yuuko|Azami Yuko]]. Mirai started off as a single illustration in the corner of the site back in 2007 and since then has gained much popularity worldwide.

There has been many Mirai collaboration projects with Japanese companies such as Good Smile Company, Cospa, [[nitroplus|Nitro Plus]], [[Kadokawa]], King Records and more.

The kanji of her name is 末永未来 but "Mirai" is written as Hiragana. Her name means "Eternal Future".
[/quote]

Mirai has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[twin braids]] and an [[ahoge]]. 

[[Suenaga Haruka]] is her younger sister.

h4. Profile
From [1]
[quote]Name: Mirai Suenaga
Japanese Name: 末永みらい (すえながみらい)
Birthday: March 3rd
Height: 165cm
3 size: B86cm W58cm H85cm
Age: Forever sweet 17
Blood type: -Unknown- (has rare DNA)

Mirai Suenaga is the main character of [[Mirai Millennium]]. She is a 2nd year high-school student at Asakusa Metropolitan High School a covert member of the Solar Marine Crimson Force. After classes, Mirai participates in the news club activities at school where she is both a newscaster and reporter. Mirai has a bit of a shy side but at heart she is a very reliable young girl. She has a strong curiosity and will follow it through to the end with adventurous spirit. Her favorite food is oranges, and her favorite color is also orange. Her dream is to become a camerawoman.
[/quote]


h4. See also

* [[Azami Yuuko]]
* [[Culture Japan]]
* [[Mirai Millennium]]

h4. External links

* [1] "Complete profile at [i]Culture Japan[/i]":http://www.dannychoo.com/post/en/1587/Mirai+Suenaga.html

title: "pour_la_justice"_(genshin_impact)
body:
"Pour la Justice" is a special food item that the player has a chance to obtain by cooking [[La Lettre a Focalors (Genshin Impact)|]] with Furina.

Pour la Justice increases all party members' Max HP by 30% for 300s. Like most foods, this cannot target other players' characters in Co-Op Mode.

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Pour la Justice":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/%22Pour_la_Justice%22]
other_names: プル・ラ・ジャスティス

title: miranda_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A Nikke from the A.C.P.U. together with [[Poli (Nikke)|Poli]] and [[Quiry (Nikke)|]]. She has no lack of passion but sometimes falls short in her work performance. Despite her supposed secret of being an A.C.P.U. inspector, everyone is all too aware of it.

She has [[pink eyes|pink]]/[[brown eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] she wears with [[twintails]] and [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[military hat]], a [[crop top]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[sailor collar]] and a [[red neckerchief]], tied to a [[black skirt| black]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]]. She wears [[black thighhighs]], [[black gloves]] and a [[belt pouch]]. Also wears [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[knee boots]].

Illustrator: [[Kim Hyung Tae|Kim Hyung-tae]]

h4. Official art

* !post #5948916: Default
* !post #8229619: [[miranda (thief of justice) (nikke)|Thief of Justice]]

title: socket_wrench
body:
A [[wrench]] that use specifically shaped holes on their ends (usually a hexagon or square), called sockets, that allowed the wrench to turn many [[bolt (hardware)|]]s, [[nut (hardware)|]]s, and other fasteners of different sizes and shapes.
 
The sockets can be on separate metal pieces that can attached to the wrench, making it [[socket (tool)|interchangeable]] with other sockets, or are physically fixed to the wrench. The wrenches can either features a reversible [b]ratcheting mechanism[/b] or not, which allows the user to pivot the tool back and forth to turn its socket instead of removing and repositioning the wrench to do so, during its usage in enclosed space. hence the reason why some of them are referred as ratchets.

This tag also applies to any tools for the similar purpose (like a breaker bar), or any specific kinds of socket wrenches.

h4. See also

* [[Impact wrench]]
* [[Lug wrench]]
* [[Socket (tool)]]
* [[torque_wrench ]]


h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Socket Wrench":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socket_wrench]

title: mad_max:_fury_road
body:
Fourth instalment of the Mad Max franchise released in 2015 after a three decade break. Has the most over the top vehicles. The movie was well received by both critics and fans and consider the most metal, feminist movie ever made.

A prequel movie, [[Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga]] was released in 2024 which tells the backstory of [[Imperator Furiosa]], one of the main characters of Fury Road.

title: superhero_landing
body:
A type of [[pose]] where a person lands from a jump touching the ground with one knee, the sole of the other leg's foot and an open palm or fist. This has alternately been known as a "superhero landing" thanks to the 2016 [[Deadpool_(movie)|Deadpool]] film pointing out how often it is done in superhero films.

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Three-Point Landing":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThreePointLanding
other_names: スーパーヒーロー着地
スーパーヒーローランディング

title: nene_(toji_no_miko)
body:
Nene is a small non-hostile [[Aratama (toji no miko)|]] that's always by [[Mashiko Kaoru]]' side. It also serves as [[Toji no Miko]]'s [[mascot]]. Voiced by [[Matsuda Satsumi]].

Nene likes girls with [[large breasts]], and tends to leap toward their chests whenever it sees them.

title: tsubakuro_yume
body:
Character in [[Toji no Miko]]. One of four [[origami yukari|Yukari's]] bodyguards. A prodigy that show a childish personality appropriate for her age, also has a battle maniac mode. [spoiler]However a unknown disease struck her, making her bedridden for a long time until Yukari arrive and recruit her as her bodyguard. After a tense fight against [[etou kanami|Kanami]] in episode 11, she's exhausted and her health broke down. She passed away some time later [/spoiler]. Voiced by [[Minase Inori]].

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] styled in [[one side up]], and a [[grey eyes|grey]]/[[blue eyes]]. Her katana is Nikkari Ao'e and she use Ten'nen Rishin-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: teenage_mutant_ninja_turtles_(1987)
body:
The first animated series adaptation of the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]]. It aired from 1987 to 1996, and ran for 10 seasons.

This series series follows the adventures of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and their allies as they battle the Shredder, Krang, and numerous other villains and criminals. The property was changed considerably from the darker-toned [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (Mirage Comics)|comics]], to make it more suitable for children and families.

The show was the first television appearance of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and helped launch the characters into mainstream popularity, becoming one of the most popular animated series in television history. Action figures, breakfast cereals, plush toys, and other merchandise featuring the characters appeared on the market during the late 1980s and early 1990s and became top sellers worldwide. By 1990, the series was being shown daily on more than 125 television stations.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_(1987_TV_series)]

title: teenage_mutant_ninja_turtles_(2012)
body:
The third animated series adaptation of the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]], produced by [[Nickelodeon]]. It aired from 2012 to 2017, and ran for 5 seasons.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2012 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_(2012_TV_series)]

title: teenage_mutant_ninja_turtles_(2003)
body:
The second animated series adaptation of the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]], produced by [[4Kids|4Kids Entertainment]]. It aired from 2003 to 2010, and ran for 7 seasons.

Unlike the previous animated series, the 2003 series more closely matches the serious tone of the original comics, with a greater emphasis on action and themes of familial bonds. The series adapts a large scope of story arcs from the comics, with the Turtles' adventures combining elements of both fantasy and science fiction.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2003 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_(2003_TV_series)]

title: street_fighter_6
body:
The seventh main installment of the [[Street Fighter]] franchise. Released globally on 2 June 2023. The game is the first to set after the fall of [[M. Bison|M. Bison]] as depicted in [[street fighter III (series)|Street Fighter III]]/[[Street Fighter V|V]].

h4. New characters

body:

title: hakan
body:
[b]Hakan[/b] is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. He made his debut as the tenth and final new fighter in [[street_fighter_iv_(series)|Super Street Fighter IV]].

Hakan is the president of the world's leading edible oil manufacturer and a leader in Turkey's national sport of Yağlı güreş. He enters the S.I.N. tournament to showcase his skills, while also traveling the world in search of inspiration for a new oil recipe.

During the tournament, Hakan encounters his old friend, [[e. honda|E. Honda]]. Their meeting gets competitive when each claims that theirs is the best fighting style in the world, and a match ensues. Honda loses and acknowledges that it was a good fight, but warns Hakan not to expect him to lose next time as he leaves. Hakan then muses that Japan has a number of different oils, and tells his family that they are heading to Japan to expand their business.

title: sumo
body:
A [[Japan]]ese competitive [[wrestling]] sport where a [[wrestler]] attempts to force another wrestler either down to the ground or out of a circular ring. It is considered the national sport of Japan.

Traditional sumo wrestler, or [i]rikishi[/i] (力士), typically features heavy yet [[muscular]] build (that is often mistakenly believed or depicted as being [[fat]] or [[obese]]), and is wearing [[chonmage]] hair and [[mawashi]] during the match.

Tagged also used for

* Describing the action and stance of a character.
* The appearance of a character in Sumo attire. (e.g. [[mawashi]])

h4. See also

* [[gunbai]]  - used by scoring referees in sumo wrestling matches
* [[E. Honda]]

title: e._honda
body: [b]Edmond Honda[/b] or [b]E. Honda[/b] is a character of the [[Street Fighter]] series, first starring in [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]. An [i]ozeki[/i]-ranked [[sumo]] wrestler from Japan

title: killing_of_brian_thompson
body:
On December 4, 2024, United Healthcare CEO [[Brian Thompson]] was shot and killed in a targeted assassination outside of his New York hotel. The accused killer, tentatively identified as [[Luigi Mangione]], had written the words "deny," "defend," and "depose" on the bullets, prompting a wave of support from online commentators frustrated with the American healthcare system.

h4. See also

* [[Luigi Mangione]]
* [[Delay Deny Defend]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Killing of Brian Thompson":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Brian_Thompson]

title: delay_deny_defend
body:
[i]Delay, Deny, Defend: Why Insurance Companies Don't Pay Claims and What You Can Do About It[/i] is a 2010 book by Rutgers Law School professor Jay M. Feinman. It is a critical exploration of how the property and casualty insurance industry prioritizes profits over policyholders' needs, often using tactics like delaying or denying legitimate claims to bolster financial performance.

h4. See also

* [[Killing of Brian Thompson]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Delay, Deny, Defend":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delay%2C_Deny%2C_Defend]

title: 2024_attempted_assassination_of_donald_trump
body:
An assassination attempt targeting the former [[United States]] president [[Donald Trump]] at a 2024 Republican party election campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania on July 13, 2024.

Trump was shot at while giving a speech and survived the attack with minor injury, apparently sustaining a wound near his right ear and defiantly pumping his fist in the air as he was taken away by his security detail. The shooter, 20 years old Thomas Matthew Crooks, was killed by a Secret Service Counter Assault Team sniper shortly after the assassination attempt. Another attendee was also killed by Crooks as well.

The photographs of Trump [[raised_fist|raising his fist]] with an [[American flag]] floating in the background became a subject of [[meme]]s, either in  [[politics|political]] support of Trump or as [[satire]] related to the event. 

h4. Images

* !asset #22198394
* !asset #22199718

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Florida":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Florida

title: samoyed_(dog)
body:
A Siberian breed of medium-sized white- or cream-colored sled [[dog|dogs]].

[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Keno (fate)|]] is a Samoyed. In the same game, [[Setanta (fate)|]] is frequently seen accompanied by similar dogs with blue tongues and ears, and [[Cavall ii (fate)|]] is most likely one as well.

title: shinjuku_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Pseudo-Singularity I: Quarantined Territory of Malice, Shinjuku[/b]
[quote]
When you untangle all of history, something massive must fall by the wayside.
A scenario penned by discarded madness.
Half-forgotten myths from the turn of the century.
This Pseudo-Singularity is a murder case of unprecedented scale.
The perfect crime is set in motion.
Dance through the decadent streets, you phantoms.
[/quote]
The first pseudo-singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the [[Japan]]ese ward of [[Shinjuku (tokyo)|]] in 1999. After the events of the [[Solomon (singularity) (fate/grand order)|Solomon singularity]], several [[demon pillar (fate)|]]s escaped and created subcategory singularities, resulting in the creation of Shinjuku (among others). Here the demon pillar Baal became able to fuse phantom spirits with heroic spirits due to the Counter Force being deactivated with its separation from human history, resulting in servants who wouldn't normally exist.

Released on the Japanese server on February 24, 2017 and on the NA server on February 24, 2019. It was adapted into a manga by [[Sasaki Shounen]].

Upon release of Shinjuku (and the other pseudo-singularities), the true name of several new servants was initially hidden; however official Fate/Grand Order media would later forego keeping their true names hidden in promotional materials. Their aliases are listed below, but their true names are used on Danbooru for tagging.

title: cavall_ii_(fate)
body: A small white [[dog]] seen in the Shinjuku incident of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. [[Saber Alter]] gives him the name, which is the same as King Arthur's dog, and treats him like a fellow knight.

title: shidou_maki_(toji_no_miko)
body:
Character in [[Toji no Miko]]. One of four [[origami yukari|Yukari's]] bodyguards. A tomboy girl that serves loyalty to Origami's family, but can easily lose composure if she thinks she failed in her duty. Voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]].

She has a [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|orange]]/[[brown hair]] with a [[braided sidelock]], [[orange eyes]], and a [[bandaged arm|bandaged arms]]. Her katana is Hoemaru and she use Shindou Munen-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: origami_yukari
body:
Antagonist in the first cour of [[Toji no Miko]]. Head of the prestigious family that oversees the manufacturing process of katana, and considered by many as the hero of Great Disaster of Sagami Bay that happen 20 years prior to this series. [spoiler]But actually she was possesed by [[Tagitsuhime]] in exchange for life of [[juujou kagari|her]] [[etou minato|friends]], that explains her youthful look. Tagitsuhime using her as human puppet until being defeated by [[juujou hiyori|Hiyori]] and [[etou kanami|Kanami]] on episode 12, freeing her consciousness[/spoiler]. Voiced by [[Seto Asami]].
 
She has a [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] with [[hair over one eye|hair over her right eye]], [[red eyes|red]] or [[orange eyes]]. Her katana are Okanehira and Doujigiri Yasutsuna. She use Niten Ichi-ryu as her fighting style.

title: santa_alter
body:
An alternate costume for [[Saber Alter]] featured in [[Fate/Grand Order]] to celebrate Christmas. This version of Artoria is Rider-class.

Do not use the [[Saber Alter]] tag with this one unless both characters are depicted together, or one is [[cosplay|cosplaying]] as the other.

body:
[[Saber (fate)|]]'s previous master, freelancer and infamously known as the Magus Killer.  Husband of [[Irisviel von Einzbern]], father of [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]] and [[Emiya Shirou]].

A [[Emiya Kiritsugu (assassin)|servant]] and Counter Guardian under the Assassin designation in the Fate/Zero Accel event in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: giuseppe_garibaldi_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Italian cruiser [i]Giuseppe Garibaldi[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]], [[pink eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default (and only) outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[red shirt]] top with [[armpit cutout]]s and an [[aiguillette]], [[white shirt|white]] undershirt for the bust, [[white hat|white]] [[mini hat|mini]] [[shako cap]] resembling her real-life bridge, [[red skirt]], [[red footwear|red]] [[knee boots]], and [[white gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with the [[Regia Marina]]'s red-white stripes, four 152 mm triple/twin gun mounts with liferafts on top, and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]].

title: mini_nobu_(fate)
body:
[[Chibi]] versions of [[Oda Nobunaga (koha-ace)|]] illustrated in [[Keikenchi]]'s [[Keikenchi (style)|style]], seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s GUDAGUDA-themed events as comic relief NPCs and enemies. It's origin is of Nobunaga's sub-consciousness when she made contact with the Imperial Grail. They can only say the word, "Nobu," and while they are weak individually, they are effective when working as a mob. There are several variants of Mini Nobus such as the default, the giant-sized one, one riding in a UFO, another in a miniature tank, another as a robot with stretchable arms, another dressed like [[Elvis Presley]], and another dressed as a [[Shinsengumi]] swordsman.

This tag refers to the specific chibi variant. If you see a generic-looking chibi Nobunaga like post #2632470, do not use this tag.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6930357: All Mini Nobu variations as of GUDAGUDA Super Goryokaku

title: meslamtaea_(fate)
body: The signature [[spear]] weapon held by the Lancer-class servant [[ereshkigal (fate)|Ereshkigal]] in Fate/Grand Order.

title: gilgamesh_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|]] character who appears in [[Fate/zero]], [[Fate/stay night]], [[Fate/strange Fake]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. 

The heroic spirit of the legendary Sumerian king. Identifying as a demigod and the 'King of Heroes,' he possesses the appearance of a [[blonde hair|blonde]], [[red eyes|red-eyed]] man in [[gold armor|golden]] [[armor]]. Some appearances depict him without his armor, revealing his [[toned]] body.

He is originally summoned by [[Tohsaka Tokiomi]] during the Fuyuki Grail Wars in [[Fate/Zero]]. Following his death, he formed a contract with [[Kotomine Kirei]], who helped him take measures allowing him to survive into the Fifth Grail War in [[Fate/stay night]]. While the Fuyuki Grail summons him into the Archer class, his existence in [[Fate/extra CCC]] is unable to be constrained by class.

In [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], he takes a magic potion to become a younger version of himself, known as [[Child Gilgamesh (fate)|]], while in [[Fate/strange Fake]], he is the "False" Archer-class Servant of [[Tine Chelc]].

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], he becomes an ally and playable Servant as the Wise King of Uruk under the [[Gilgamesh (Caster) (Fate)|]] designation.

Notable for his arrogant and narcissistic personality, with him calling almost any other non-Sumerians or gods as "mongrel" (雑種 - [i]zasshu[/i]). He is enamored by [[Saber (fate)|]] for her beauty and noble spirit, her continual refusal of him only compounding his obsessive desire.

Voiced by [[Seki Tomokazu]].

title: vimana_(fate)
body: A flying contraption passed down from Babylon to India and recorded in the two epic sagas, Ramayana and Mahabharata, that is owned by [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]] and contained within the [[Gate of Babylon (fate)|]]. In [[Fate/Zero]], Gilgamesh uses it to engage [[Berserker (fate/zero)|]]'s F-15J Fighter Jet. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], it is used as [[Arjuna Alter (fate)|]] base of operations in the Indian Lostbelt.

title: berserker_(fate/zero)
body:
[[Fate/Zero]] character.

A towering man clad in black-bluish [[full armor|full plate armor]], wearing a plumed [[helmet]] that conceals his face. Sometimes he's depicted with his helmet off, with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and a gaunt face.

[b]True Name:[/b] [[Lancelot (fate/zero)|]]. He also has a [[Fate/Grand Order]] incarnation where he fights under the [[Lancelot (fate/grand order)|Saber]] designation.

For tagging purposes, only also tag [[Lancelot (Fate/Zero)]] if it's clearly his original appearance in the Berserker armor or both appear in the image. Not all helmetless depictions of Berserker are his original version. Some of the differences between the two can be seen in asset #23661650.

Not to be mistaken with [[Heracles (fate)|]].

h4.Variants

title: monohoshizao_(fate)
body: The [[sword]] carried by [[Sasaki Kojirou (Fate)|]] from [[Fate (series)|]], based on the sword used by the historical [[Sasaki Kojirou]], who is said to have died in a duel with [[Miyamoto Musashi]] in 1612. It boasts an unusually long and heavy blade for a Japanese sword, and it takes an extraordinary man to even draw it from its scabbard, much less wield it in combat.

title: mini_cu-chan_(fate)
body:
A [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]] featuring a [[chibi]] variation of [[Cu Chulainn Alter (fate)|]]. It originally appeared in the game's [[Mahou Shoujo Kikou ~Prisma Codes~|Prisma Codes]] event. He also shows up in both [[anastasia (fate)|Anastasia]] and [[paris (fate)|Paris]]'s Valentine events, forming a rivalry with the dolls they give the protagonist.

This tag is specific to the chibi version seen in FGO. If he is depicted as a non-canon chibi (like post #2348112), don't use this tag. Also, do not add the [[Cu Chulainn Alter (fate)|]] tag if Mini-Cu is by himself. They are treated as separate characters and should only be tagged together if both are present in the image.

title: london_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Fourth Singularity: The Mist City, London[/b]
[quote]
The fourth Grand Order is set in 1888.

The Great British Empire in the Industrial Revolution Age where civilization flourished.

This new fierce battle shall commence around the fourth Holy Grail, in this city isolated by a demonic fog.
[/quote]
The fourth singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It's set in the year 1888 in the city of [[London]] during the industrial revolution, where the city has been enveloped in a magical [[fog]] created by a steam engine powered by the era's [[holy grail (fate)|]].

title: heian-kyou_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Naraka Mandala, Heian-kyou[/b]
[quote]
The members of Chaldea return from their brutal struggle in the Fifth Lostbelt. As they prepare to begin their mission in the next Lostbelt, they detect a new Singularity, which is marked as a sign of Humanity's collapse. Until now, it had been believed that no such signs could be seen upon the bleached earth, where human history has come to an end.

It is in the Heian period in Japan. The splendid capital Heian-kyou enjoys tremendous prosperity under the enduring rule of the Fujiwara clan.

But after Rayshifting to what should be a time of plenty, Chaldea instead finds a world overrun by evil spirits and infested by horrid abominations. In this land, "Imperial Warriors" conduct a ritual modeled after a Holy Grail War.

Who are the Imperial Warriors, and what purpose does their ritual serve? In this mysterious, millennium-old city, Chaldea's Master faces the machinations of the Beautiful Carnivore.
[/quote]
A singularity that formed on the bleached earth in [[Fate/Grand Order]], created and maintained by [[Ashiya Douman (fate)|]] where he attempts to transition it into its own Lostbelt. It's set in Japan in A.D. 1008 and takes place following the events of [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]]. Released on the Japanese server December 4, 2020 and on the NA server on November 21, 2022.

title: saber_wars
body:
[b]SABER WARS ~The Caliburn Awakens~[br]Lily's Cosmic Winter Rebellion[/b]
[quote]It is a period of Holy Grail War. CHALDEA enjoys an uneasy moment of peace as the struggle for humanity's future continues. Seeking the elusive ARTORIUM, a mysterious alien has appeared from the sky, but her true motives remain hidden. Saber Lily, the youngest fighter of the Unenhanced NP Alliance, sets out on a journey that will shape her destiny...
[/quote]

title: traum_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Realm of the Thanatos Impulse, Traum[/b]
[quote]
Having conquered the British Lostbelt and the NFF HQ, Chaldea detects a massive Singularity with an immeasurable Humanity Foundation Value. It is a world split into three realms—each with its own king—where Servants are ceaselessly summoned to battle each other.

Chaldea's Master is overwhelmed by the unthinkable sight of armies of Servants clashing ceaselessly. As if to make things worse, an unseen hand slowly but surely reaches out for Master.

"Who could have done this, and why? Most importantly, how did they summon so many Servants?"

This is not a typical mission into a Singularity. Who could this Master be? Some mysteries may be better left unsolved...
[/quote]

A singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in North America and occurring before the events of [[Nahui Mictlan (fate)|]]. [spoiler]It is maintained by [[Specimen E]] in order to enact revenge on the Human Order.[/spoiler] It was released on the Japanese server on June 1, 2022, and on the NA server on May 13, 2024.

title: takenashi_eri
body:
Manga artist. Creator of [[kannagi|Kannagi]].

Has also drawn doujinshi based on [[type-moon|TYPE-MOON]]'s works, with [[phantas-moon|Phantas-Moon]] being the most popular creation in that field. She later became a TYPE-MOON collaborator, producing official comics, illustrations and character designs, such as [[TAKE MOON]], [[Johanna (fate)|]] and [[Pino (fate)|]].

title: nakano_umi
body: Umi Nakano is a supporting character in the [[kanojo_okarishimasu|Kanojo Okarishimasu]] series. He is a friend of [[mizuhara_chizuru|Chizuru Ichinose]] and attends the same acting school as her.

title: neco_spirit
body:
A race of catlike humanoids appearing throughout [[Type-Moon]] media, based on the gag character [[Neco-Arc]] from [[Tsukihime]]. Their appearances are commonly [[chibi]] parodies of other Type-Moon characters, often with exaggerated or juvenile personalities. Many Neco Spirits reside in the Great Cat's Village, their home realm. Usually illustrated with [[<|>_<|>]] or [[=_=]] eyes.

title: mysterious_neco_y
body: A [[Neco Spirit]] seen in [i][[Fate/Grand Carnival]][/i], based on [[Carmilla (fate)|]]. Due to their dramatic actions and shared seiyuu of [[Tanaka Atsuko]], she is the counterpart to [[Neco-arc Destiny]].

title: mysterious_neco_x
body: A [[Neco Spirit]] based on [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]]. In [i][[Fate/Grand Carnival]][/i], she fills the role of [[Neco-Arc]] as seen in [i][[Carnival Phantasm]][/i].

title: neco-arc_bubbles
body:
A [[Neco Spirit]] first appearing in [[Carnival Phantasm]], voiced by [[Ciel (tsukihime)|]]'s voice actress [[Sakuma Kumi]]. Looks nigh-identical to [[Neco-Arc]], but can be distinguished by the permanent [[blush]] marks on her face, her slightly more yellow hair, and her [[aqua skirt]].

title: mysterious_neco_w
body: A [[Neco Spirit]] introduced in [[Fate/Grand Carnival]], based on [[Frankenstein's Monster (fate)|]] and voiced by [[Nonaka Ai]]. She serves as a counterpart to [[Neco-arc Bubbles]], being similarly energetic characters who communicate through grunts.

title: suzuhara_lulu
body:
Suzuhara Lulu was a [[Nijisanji]] affiliated [[virtual youtuber|Virtual Liver]]. She debuted on the same day as [[Yukishiro Mahiro]].

Due to some odd events (such as streaming ten hours of [[Ring Fit Adventure]] [i] immediately after[/i] streaming ten hours of [[Dark Souls I]]), Lulu gained a reputation for behaving like some sort of inhuman creature, a notion further developed by her habit of staring directly at the viewer when something doesn't go as it should and her weird remarks like implying her eyeballs can regenerate after being crushed, while claiming to be nothing but a normal college student.

She is part of the [[Saine Sisters]] trio along with [[Kamishiro Kurea]] and [[Sephira Su]], as the three virtual youtubers were designed by [[Saine]] and consider themselves sisters, sometimes appearing in each other channels.

Unexpectedly announced she would be graduating and ceasing activities on June 30, 2021.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, it is the same as her [[akai haato (1st costume)|default]] costumes, but with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s and black [[heart hair ornament|heart ornaments]] instead.

title: robocop
body:
A [[cyberpunk]] movie franchise about [[Robocop (character)|]], a recently-murdered [[police]] officer who is revived as a heavily-armored [[cyborg]].

h4. Movies

* [[RoboCop 1]]: An officer is murdered and turned into a product to fight crime for Detroit. Corruption plagues the company that rebuilt him.
* [[RoboCop 2]]: Omnicorp tries to improve on the original product, while Detroit faces a new drug problem- [i]Nuke[/i]
* [[RoboCop 3]]: [todo]
* [[RoboCop (2014)]]: A reboot following the same premise as the first movie, with a much more modern look than what people expected in the 80s.

h4. See also

* [[ED-209]]: A powerful but poorly-programmed robot put forward as an alternative to the RoboCops
* [[RoboCop (character)|]]: The title character
* [[Peter Weller]]: The actor who played RoboCop
* [[Auto-9]]: RoboCop's signature handgun
* [[Lady BattleCop]]: A Japanese film heavily inspired by RoboCop.

title: mr._rabbit_(brown)_(rusty_lake)
body:
A character in the [[Rusty Lake]] series, first introduced in Rusty Lake Hotel.

He is a [[rabbit boy|rabbit]] [[furry]] with [[brown fur]].

He dresses [[formal clothes|formal]]ly, wearing a [[traditional bowtie|traditional]] [[black bowtie|black]] [[bowtie]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a [[plaid coat|plaid]] [[black coat|black]] [[tailcoat]], a [[red vest|red]] [[waistcoat]], a pair of [[black pants|black]] [[dress pants]], a pair of [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], and a pair of [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].

Note that this Mr. Rabbit and the white-furred Mr. Rabbit featured extensively in Cube Escape: Birthday are formally treated as separate characters on Danbooru due to plot ambiguity on whether the two are the same person or not. The other Mr. Rabbit can be found under [[Mr. Rabbit (White) (Rusty Lake)]].

h4. External links
* "Mr. Rabbit | Rusty Lake Wiki | Fandom":[https://rusty-lake.fandom.com/wiki/Mr._Rabbit]

title: mr._rabbit_(white)_(rusty_lake)
body:
A character in the [[Rusty Lake]] series, first introduced in Rusty Lake Hotel as an easter egg, featured more extensively in later Cube Escape Birthday.

He is a [[rabbit boy|rabbit]] [[furry]] with [[white fur]]. His eyes are also solid [[black sclera|black]], with [[no pupils]].

He dresses [[formal clothes|formal]]ly, wearing a [[brown suit|brown]] [[business suit|business]] [[suit]], with a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], a [[black necktie|black]] [[necktie]], a pair of [[brown gloves|brown]] [[gloves]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

Note that this Mr. Rabbit and the brown-furred Mr. Rabbit featured extensively in Rusty Lake Hotel are formally treated as separate characters on Danbooru due to plot ambiguity on whether the two are the same person or not. The other Mr. Rabbit can be found under [[Mr. Rabbit (Brown) (Rusty Lake)]].

h4. External links
* "Mr. Rabbit | Rusty Lake Wiki | Fandom":[https://rusty-lake.fandom.com/wiki/Mr._Rabbit]

title: laimu_(vtuber)
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. [i]Not to be confused with [[Lime (Vtuber)|]].[/i]

She is a [[lime (Fruit)|]]-themed [[ferret]] [[ferret girl|girl]], though before debuting as a VTuber, she was portrayed as a [[seal (animal)|]].

Streaming since 2011, she debuted as a VTuber in September of 2021. She is heavily associated with [[Vinesauce]], a loose collective of streamers affiliated with the group's titular streamer.

She has since gone on to grow significantly, having collaborated with other VTubers like [[Snuffy (Vtuber)|]], [[Dokibird (Vtuber)|]], and [[Mint Fantome]], among many others, such as [[Bao (Vtuber)|]], [[Matara Kan]], and many other [[VShojo]] girls.

When streaming with Dokibird, Mint Fantome, and Snuffy, they are known as the "Sloppy Sisters."

title: strawberry_baelz
body:
Alternate costume for [[Hakos Baelz]]. Like her later [[Blackberry Baelz]] outfit, this one is based on a fanmade 3D model by [[Yoolie]]. The outfit's name was coined by Baelz herself based on its appearance in a live-action segment about a strawberry farm during "her second birthday stream":[https://youtu.be/ts1-_YGubh0?t=1541].

The complete outfit consists of white [[ankle boots]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[animal ear legwear|mouse-shaped thigbands]], denim [[short shorts]], a [[white sweater]] with the same front design as her normal shirt, a [[blue scarf]], and a [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[hair bow]]; her hairstyle also changes to a [[very long hair|very long]] set of [[twin braids]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6106832

title: blackberry_baelz

title: chagall
body: A major antagonist in [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]'s First Generation. The treacherous, but cowardly, king of Agustria who murdered his father to claim the throne, before waging war against the weakened Grannvale at the behest of [[Manfroy (Fire Emblem)|]]. He is also a distant relative of [[Eldigan (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Lachesis (Fire Emblem)|]] due to possessing minor Hodr Holy Blood.

title: reccoa_londe
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] universe.

She first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] series from 1985. 

[b]Reccoa Londe[/b] is an [[orange hair]]ed member of the [[AEUG]] intelligence division and [[Mobile Suit]] [[pilot]], her [[mecha]] of choice is the [[Methuss]]. [spoiler]Reccoa met and became friends with [[Kai Shiden]] during a mission infiltrating the Titans' base at Jaburo on planet Earth. Later during another infiltration mission on the Titans ship [i]The Jupitris[/i], Reccoa met [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who used his Newtype powers and charm to discover her disguise and affiliation and eventually turn her to the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] side. Reccoa was given the [[Palace Athene]] MS by Scirocco and she killed [[Bask Om]] after destroying his ship with it (on Paptimus orders). Reccoa Londe died fighting against [[Emma Sheen]]'s [[Gundam Mk II]] at the final battle of The Gryps War.[/spoiler]

title: tingyun_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

Amicassador of the Sky-Faring Commission of the Xianzhou Luofu. Voiced by [[Takada Yuuki]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed as a [[fox girl]] with [[medium hair|medium-length]] (Harmony) or [[long hair|long]] (Nihility) [[brown hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[multicolored hair|ends]], [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]]/s, and [[green eyes]]. 

h4. Playable variations

* !post #7690421: [[Tingyun (Harmony) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Harmony]] (4-star)
* !post #8651422: [[Fugue (honkai: star rail)|]] (Nihility, 5-star)

h4. Other costumes

* !post #8472322: [[Fugue (Jiaduobao) (honkai: star rail)|Jiaduobao collab]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
A silver-tongued Foxian girl, Tingyun is the Head Representative of the Whistling Flames, a merchant guild officially approved by the Sky-Faring Commission.

She has such a way with words that often leaves her audience eagerly waiting for more of her captivating tales. As a result of her supervision, the Xianzhou trade fairs are now known throughout the galaxy.

"Try one's best to avoid conflict when possible, and persuade those who can be persuaded" — that's Tingyun's motto.
[/expand]

title: bellona_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Bellona[/i] (63). Character design by [[Ohisashiburi]].

In-game, she is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. Her outfit consists of an [[ascot]], [[brown shirt]], [[white shorts]], red-white [[waist cape]], a [[white jacket]], [[black feathers]] on her jacket serving as a [[single epaulette]], [[black gloves]], and black [[thigh boots]]. She also has a [[sword]] as a melee weapon.

Her [[rigging]] is essentially the same as her sister [i]Black Prince[/i], having all four of her historical 13.3 cm twin DP gun mounts, two each side, as well as two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] painted red, one on each side.

title: jingliu_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Kuwashima Houko]] (JP) and [[Amanda Lee]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] that is tied into a [[ponytail]], [[red eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]], [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]], [[black gloves]], [[black blindfold]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

h4. Skins
* !post #7691288: Default
* !post #7484064: [[Jingliu (Star Rail Live 2024) (honkai: star rail)|Star Rail Live 2024]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
Former Sword Champion of the Luofu, and the creator of the Cloud Knights' legends of undefeated might.
Now, her name has been wiped from the records, and she is a traitor of the Xianzhou walking on the fine line between sanity and mara-struck.
"Whoever wishes to learn my swordplay, I will teach them."

One of the legendary heroes making up the the High-Cloud Quintet, and bestowed with the title "Transcendent Flash."

Having ascended beyond mortal concepts of victory, she chose to walk a different path to obtain the power capable of slaying gods.

Thereafter, one Sword Champion of the Luofu was removed from the Xianzhou's records, and one nameless traitor was added.
[/expand]

title: mamiya_tomosane
body:
[[mamiya hasaki|Hasaki Mamiya]]'s older brother and the true protagonist of [[Subarashiki Hibi]]. 

His appearance is similar to [[mamiya takuji|Takuji Mamiya]], but with dark [[blue eyes]].

[spoilers]
Takuji, [[minakami yuki|Yuki Minakami]], and [[yuuki tomosane|Tomosane Yuuki]] are his split personalities. He created Takuji and Yuki based on his [[mamiya takuji (real)|deceased brother]] and crush respectively, while Tomosane Yuuki is loosely inspired on the real Tomosane and his struggle to reclaim his lost identity.
[/spoilers]

title: seven_prisoners_(blue_archive)
body:
The Seven Prisoners (七囚人, Seven Prisoners) are a group of problem students in Kivotos.

Seven Prisoners is an umbrella term used to refer to the seven students that broke out of the Correction Bureau after the General Student Council President's disappearance. Because only problem students are sent to the Correction Bureau, all seven students belonging to the Seven Prisoners are extremely dangerous, in one way or another. It is later revealed that [[Professor Niyaniya (blue_archive)|]] was responsible for releasing the Seven Prisoners. The tag should only be used if three or more of the Seven Prisoners appear together.

Currently known members:
*[[Akemi (blue_archive)|]]
*[[Akira (blue_archive)|]]
*[[Kai_(blue_archive)|]]
*[[Wakamo (blue_archive)|]]

https://bluearchive.fandom.com/wiki/Seven_Prisoners

title: android
body:
A [[robot]] that looks human, or very nearly human, with a fully human face.

They may appear male, female, or [[androgynous]]. Female androids, also known as gynoids, are the most common in anime. Androids often have small robotic appendages or markings to make it apparent they are not human. The most common of these are [[robot ears]], [[robot joints]], [[mechanical wings]], and attached [[cable]]s.

The difference between a [[humanoid robot]] and an [[android]] is that an android looks mostly human, usually having something resembling skin (though it needn't be skin-colored) and a fully human face, while a humanoid robot is clearly non-human, with a non-human face.

This tag should not be used if the character looks completely human, with no visible robotic traits. Tag what you see, not what you know.

Not to be confused with [[cyborg]], which is a person augmented with mechanical body parts.

h4. Examples

* !post #7999269
* !post #8597429
* !post #8648346
* !post #7042751

h4. See also

* [[cyborg]]

* [[robot girl]]
* [[robot joints]]

title: ash_baby_(meme)
body:
“Ash Baby” or “Screaming Baby Made of Ash” is an [[AI-generated]] image of a [[crying]] [[baby]] covered in [[ashes]], first popularized on Reddit in October 2022. 

Created by Redditor u/HyperCool27 using OpenAI’s [[dall-e|DALL-E 2]], the image gained further traction on TikTok in early October 2023, mainly as a reaction image in duets about bright lights burning people.

title: shinmai_fukei_kiruko-san
body: New Policewoman Kiruko-san is a Japanese comedy manga series written and illustrated by [[Hirakata Masahiro]] and serialized in Shōnen Jump from November 2012 to May 2013. The series focuses on the comedic adventures of [[otonashi Kiruko]] and [[Anjou Haruki]], two rookie [[police]]men in the kōban of the small rural town of Nagashima, and their chief, [[Tsutsui Kanjurou]].

title: payila's_shikigami_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[payila_(granblue_fantasy)|Payila's]] nameless shikigami('s). Also refered as Temple Acolyte in her intro fate episode.
Not a singular entity as several distinct shikigami's can exist at the same time. All are identical in appearance, save for the different colored hair ornaments.

Has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]], as well as [[dragon horns]]. Wears a [[miko|shrine maiden outfit]].

title: ember_(arknights)
body:
A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Ember was an Oathkeeper Knight from the Northern Desolation who served a military organization known as the Order of Steel Oath. Guided by her commitment to the Final Tribulation, she visited the Civilization Band before accepting an invitation to join Endfield Industries.

Sometimes she engages in earnest discussions about combat techniques, as if she were still battling on the brutal northern front.
[/quote]

title: wulfgard_(arknights)
body:
A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Despite his young age, Wulfgard is already very familiar with the most fickle nature of humanity. But this has never consumed his sanity and instead gives him a maturity that goes far beyond his age.

A former member of the Landbreaker clan known as the Pack, Wulfgard can be a reliable and trustworthy friend if you can earn his trust. But this is no easy feat.
[/quote]

title: endministrator_(arknights)
body:
A playable main character in [[Arknights: Endfield]].

The Endministrator of Endfield Industries.

According to the historical records of Talos-II, the Endministrator stands as a key guardian who protected civilization on this planet and saved humanity from multiple catastrophic disasters. The Endmin's heroic deeds have given rise to many stories, tales, and even rumors.

However, the Endmin's identity remains elusive and only a handful of people have seen the legend in person.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8572068: [[male_endministrator_(arknights)|Male Endministrator]]
* !post #8571901: [[female_endministrator_(arknights)|Female Endministrator]]

h4. See also

* [[Female Endministrator (Arknights)|]]
* [[Male Endministrator (Arknights)|]]

title: sm-2
body: Medium-range anti-air missile equipped on US and allied warships. Can be launched from both missile arms and [[Vertical Launching System (vls)|]] of most warships.

title: banbi
body:
A type of [[hanfu]]; a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] shirt from [[Chinese clothes|China]]. 

It can have a variety of collar types, such as a [[fold-over collar]], a [[square neckline]], a [[round neckline]] or a [[mandarin collar]].

It is sometimes depicted being [[short over long sleeves|worn over]] a [[ruqun]] garment.

h4. Examples
* !asset #24448901
* !post #6026383

h4. Trivia
* The term translates roughly to 'half-arm'; it is also known as banxiu (Chinese: 半袖), meaning 'half-sleeves'. 
* The [[beizi_(clothing)|]], which typically has long sleeves, originated from the banbi. 
* Tha banbi can also be secured at the front either with ties or a metal button, such as the [[pankou]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Banbi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banbi

title: tanling_ruqun
body:
A style of [[hanfu]], wherein a shirt ([[banbi]]) with a round collar is tucked into a skirt. Similar to the [[duijin ruqun]] and the [[jiaoling ruqun]].

H4. Examples
* !post #8266560

body:

For American Indians, use [[Native American]]. For East Indians, see the country tags of [[Indonesia]], [[Malaysia]], [[Singapore]], [[Thailand]], [[Cambodia]], [[Laos]], [[Vietnam]], and the [[Philippines]].

title: richard_i_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body: [[Richard I (fate)|]] in his Third Ascension form from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Unlike his other forms, this Ascension depicts him as a humanoid black lion who speaks in a deeper and more regal tone.

title: richard_i_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/strange Fake]] character. The "True" Saber-class Servant of [[Sajou Ayaka (fate/strange fake)|]].

The only Saber-class Servant summoned during the Holy Grail War in [[Fate/Strange Fake]]. His True Name is [b]Richard I[/b], the King of England from 1189 until 1199. He has [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[short hair with long locks]] which he ties into a [[braid]], [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[red eyes]].

He was implemented into [[Fate/Grand Order]] for the 2025 New Year’s event (2027 in NA).

h4.Costumes

title: western_comics_(style)
body:
Images in the style of traditional American/western comic books. (Not simply images featuring comic book characters.)

Typical styles in western comics include that of [[jack kirby (style)|Jack Kirby]], Neal Adams, Steve Ditko, Frank Miller, George Perez, [[Alex Ross]], [[Jim Lee]], and Rob Liefeld. Features in those styles include [[halftone|halftone printing]], [[limited palette]]s, and text in [[English text|English]] or [[romaji text|romaji]].

h4. See also

* [[Toon (style)]]

title: chips_(food)
body:
A type of [[snack]] [[food]], made by slicing potatoes, corn tortillas, or other foods into very thin strips, deep frying them, then seasoning them with salt or other savory flavors.

[[Potato chips]] are the most common type of chip.

Not to be confused with [[french fries]], which are called chips in British English.

title: vampire
body:
A being in folklore who feeds on the [[blood]] of living creatures. Notable characteristics include [[fangs]], predatory eyes, and [[pale skin]].

Although typically described as undead, a vampire could be a living person. Popularized in Europe in the 18th century and codified in literature in the 19th as a Western folkloric being distinct from its Slavic(-Turkic) roots.

This tag should not be used unless vampiric traits are clearly visible in the image.

For the game produced by Capcom, see [[Darkstalkers]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6815651

h4. Notable vampire characters

title: slavic_mythology
body:
The myths involving gods, heroes, monsters, etc. of the Slavic peoples. Most commonly, the myths of the East Slavs are depicted in art internationally, whether it be entities unique to them, or the variants of common Slavic entities domestic to them.

h4. Beings

h6. Monsters that appeared in/originated from Slavic Mythology

* [[Alkonost (mythology)|]] (East Slavic)
* [[Bauk]] (South Slavic)
* [[Kikimora (mythology)|]] (East Slavic)
* [[Rusalka (mythology)|]] (East Slavic)

h6. People, Heroes and named spirits

* [[Baba Yaga (mythology)|]] (East Slavic)
* [[Ded Moroz]]
* [[Kyrylo Kozhumyaka]] (East Slavic)
* [[Snegurochka (mythology)|]] (Russian/East Slavic)
* [[Tugarin Zmeyevich]] (East Slavic)

h4. Related copyrights

title: ded_moroz
body: A character from [[Slavic mythology]], originating as a personification of winter before becoming a character similar to Father Christmas and [[Santa Claus]] among the Slavs. Among East Slavs, whose version of the name is used for this tag, he is accompanied by [[Snegurochka (mythology)|]].

title: baba_yaga_(mythology)
body:
A witch from [[Slavic mythology]], often flying around in a mortar and living in a hut on chicken legs deep in the forest.

Included under this tag are similar baba witches which appear in Slavic myth, as Baba Yaga is commonly associated with East Slavs in specific, such as Ježibaba among the West Slavs and Baba Roga among the ex-Yugoslavs. Varyingly in myth, they are either presented as regional versions of Baba Yaga, or as her sisters/counterparts.

title: bauk
body: A bauk is a mythical creature from [[Slavic mythology|Serbian mythology]] that hides in dark places, waiting to grab and devour its victim.

body: [[Waccha Primagi!]] character.

title: shichinosato_kofuki
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko: Kizamishi Issen no Tomoshibi]] from [[Renpu girls school uniform|Renpu Girl's School]]. A straightforward girl that likes to move by herself, making her less skillful in teamwork tactics. Very fond of eradicating [[Aratama (toji no miko)|Aratama]] that even she dreamed of doing that. Voiced by [[Igarashi Hiromi]].

She has [[grey hair|grey]]/[[brown hair]], [[purple eyes]] and a [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[sleeveless jacket]]. Her katana are Chatan Nakiri and Niou Kiyotsuna. She use Escrima (Arnis) as her fighting style.

title: snowball
body:
A ball made of [[snow]], that is, frozen [[water]]. Can be used for [[snowball fight]]s or to make a [[snowman]]. 

It does [b]NOT[/b] refer to the sexual practice, that's [[cum_swap|snowballing]].

title: musumi_kiyoka
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko: Kizamishi Issen no Tomoshibi]] from [[Heijou Institute School Uniform|Heijou Institute School]]. She is a timid girl who dislike fighting. Voiced by [[Fujita Akane]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[grey eyes]] and usually wearing a [[green hairband|green]] [[polka dot hairband]]. Her katana is Renge Fudou Teruhiro and she use Bokuden-ryu as her fighting style.

title: asakura_mihono
body:
Main character and protagonist in [[Toji no Miko: Kizamishi Issen no Tomoshibi]] from [[minoseki gakuin uniform|Minoseki Gakuin]]. Optimistic and straightforward, but also can be a moodmaker. She sees [[etou kanami|Kanami]] as her domestic rival, but the latter doesn't feel the same. Voiced by [[Akaneya Himika]]. 

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[brown hair|brown]]-[[red hair]] styled in [[two side up]], [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[orange eyes]], and [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. Her katana is Kashuu Kiyomitsu and she use Shingyoto-ryu as her fighting style.

title: anti-ship_missile
body: A missile designed to sink warships and other maritime surface combatants. Launched primarily from surface ships and attack aircraft.

title: vertical_launching_system_(vls)
body: An advanced system designed to store and launch large amounts of missiles upright aboard a warship. Similar to a ground-based silo.

title: x-47b
body: An American UAV technology demonstrator built by Northrop Grumman and tested in the 2010s.

title: aratama_(toji_no_miko)
body: Monstrous creatures and enemies in [[Toji no Miko]]. They are created from Noro (leftover residue) during the process of purifying Tamahagane (special steel to create Katana). When Noro is left in abundance, it can develop into a sentient Aratama, like [[Tagitsuhime]].

title: aki_rosenthal_(gothic_lolita)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Aki Rosenthal]].

It's a [[gothic lolita]]-themed costume consisting of a [[black hairband|black]] [[frilled hairband|frilled]] [[lolita hairband]] with [[fake animal ears]], a [[black veil]], a [[short dress|short]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[black dress|black]] [[layered dress]] with [[low neckline]], a [[criss-cross halter]], a [[pocket square]][[juliet sleeves]] with [[frilled sleeves]] [[wrist cuffs]], [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], a [[black sash]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]], a [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[strappy heels]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[swept bangs|swept]] [[braided bangs]] with her [[detached hair]] tied into [[twin drills]].

title: mashiko_kaoru
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko]] from [[osafune girls academy school uniform|Osafune Girl's Academy]]. A sluggish and taciturn girl that always conserves her energy (partially because she use [[ootachi]] instead of usual [[katana]] used by other girls). Has a guardian youkai named [[nene (toji no miko)|Nene]] that always beside her. Voiced by [[Matsuda Risae]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] that [[hair ears|resembles a pair of dog ears]], [[purple eyes]], and a [[petite]] body. Her katana is Nenekirimaru and she use Yakumaru Jigen-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: itomi_sayaka
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko]] from [[Renpu girs school uniform|Renpu Girl's School]]. Looks like a quiet girl, but actually she has a hard time communicating with others. With [[yanase mai|Mai's]] help, she began showing more of her true feelings. Voiced by [[Kino Hina]]. 
 
She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair|grey]]/[[white hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair between eyes|bangs between her eyes]] and a  [[purple eyes]]. Her katana is Myoho Muramasa and she use Onoha Itto-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: exposed_bone
body:
When an otherwise/mostly intact person, animal or creature has bones that protrude through the skin or does not have an outer layer covering the bone(s). That outer layer may also be [[see-through body|transparent]].

This does [b]not[/b] include bones that are visible [b]through[/b] the skin. 

A fully visible [[skeleton]] does also [b]not[/b] fall under this tag, but should rather be tagged as [[skeleton]].

Exposed bone may or may not mean gore/[[guro]]. Many illustrations with this tag achieve the visible bones through magical or imaginary methods. X-ray can also be used to show bones. 

H4. Examples
* !post #8668848: exposed bone via [[see-through body]]
* !post #6302818: exposed bone via [[x-ray film]] 
* !post #7891845: exposed bone via no skin

title: see-through_body
body:
When objects behind (and sometimes simultaneously inside) a character can be seen through a character's skin and/or clothes, either partially or wholly. This might include a visible [[exposed bone|skeleton]] and/or [[organs]].

See-through bodies might be due to character design - such as for [[ghost]] characters, [[slime girl]]s/[[slime boy|boys]], etc - or because a character is [[fading|fading away]].

If a character has an entirely different image embedded in their skin/clothes, see [[double exposure]].

Not to be confused with [[invisible man]] which is a technique used to allow clear view of sexual scenes.

h4. Examples

* !post #5545358
* !post #7594887: With [[refraction]]
* !post #4164787

h4. See also

* [[Translucent hair]]
* [[Transparent hand]]
* [[Blending]]
* [[X-ray]]

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[flat chest]], [[tsurime|tsurime eyes]] and typically wears an [[orange shirt]] and [[orange skirt]]. title: peni_parker
body:
A young girl introduced as one of the many Spider Totems in [[Spider-Man (series)|]]'s [[Spider-Verse]] storyline. Based off several cyberpunk anime series like [[Akira (manga)|]], [[Serial Experiments Lain]] and [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], her role in her home universe is to pilot the giant mecha [[SP//dr]], which has taken a toll on her mental state.

An alternative version of her appears in the film [[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse]], where she appears to be a younger and much cheerier high school student with SP//dr as a mini-mecha companion. Her design instead embraces the "[[moe (phrase)|]]" aesthetic, while still keeping some technological elements of her comics counterpart. Her later appearance in [[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]] has her looking much closer to her comic book appearance.

Peni's default outfit is a [[school uniform]] (a black [[sweater]] in the comics, a black [[sweater vest]] in the film), with a matching [[pleated skirt]]. She has messy [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]].

title: pronghorn
body: A species of artiodactyl mammal (like the deer) found in western and central North America. It is known as the second fastest land mammal in the world (or the fastest in the Western Hemisphere). Although slower than the African cheetah at top speed, it can sustain the high speeds much longer than cheetahs.

title: the_amazing_bag_man
body:
An alternate costume of [[Spider-Man]]. Consists of a [[Fantastic Four]] uniform and a paper bag as mask.
Peter originally wore this costume after getting rid of his [[symbiote]]-infested black costume at the Baxter Building, courtesy of [[Johnny Storm]] (along with a "kick me" sign).

The costume gained fame thanks to appearing in several Spider-Man videogames as an unlockable.

title: vesna_mikovic
body:
Character from [[Brave Witches]], hailing from Ostmark.

She was trained by [[Edytha Rossmann]] and had a short-lived romance with [[Waltrud Krupinski]]. She would later join the reformed [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. 
Her weapon is an MG34 machine gun, her familiar is a Croatian sheepdog, and she's based on Veca Micovič.

title: misumi_miya
body:
Character from [[Brave Witches]].

Introduced as [[Karibuchi Hikari]]'s rival cadet in episode 1, she would later go on to join the reformed [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]].

Her weapon is a Type 99-2 Model 2 Kai training rifle, and her familiar is a white cat.

title: kuroda_kunika
body:
Character from [[Noble Witches]]

A Flying officer from Fuso serving in the [[506th Joint Fighter Wing]]. From a branch family of a daimyou clan.

Her weapons are a Ho-103 machine gun and MG42. Her familiar is a shiba inu, and she's based on Kuroki Tameyoshi.

title: ed-209
body: The [b]E[/b]nforcement [b]D[/b]roid Series 209 is a heavily-armed but poorly-designed robot from the [[Robocop]] franchise. It is famously incapable of using stairs without losing its balance.

title: auto-9
body:
The signature [[weapon]] of the [[Robocop (character)|title character]] of the [[RoboCop]] film franchise. The Auto-9 prop was a modified [[Beretta 93R]] [b][[handgun|machine pistol]][/B], and it accepts 50-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|]]s. 

Originally intended to be a modified [[Desert Eagle]] (which ended in the film as the sidearm of one of the villains), the Desert Eagle proved to appear too small in the hands of RoboCop, so the director opted to use the bigger looking modified Beretta instead.

h1. External links
* "RoboCop Wikia":https://robocop.fandom.com/wiki/Auto_9

title: peter_weller
body:
Peter Francis Weller (born June 24, 1947) is an American actor and television director.
He has appeared in more than 70 films and television series, including [[RoboCop]] (1987) and its sequel [[RoboCop 2]] (1990), in which he played the titular character; The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension (1984); and [[star trek: kelvin timeline|Star Trek Into Darkness]] (2013). He appeared in such films as Woody Allen's Mighty Aphrodite (1995), the Oliver Stone-produced The New Age (1994), and David Cronenberg's adaptation of William Burroughs's novel [[Naked Lunch]] (1991).

title: robocop_(character)
body:
Titular [[cyborg]] from [[Robocop|the franchise of the same name]]. Played by actor [[Peter Weller]]. Robocop is [spoilers][[police]] officer Alex Murphy, who was killed in the line of duty but promptly revived as a cyborg.[/spoilers]

The design of the character was actually inspired by [[Judge Dredd]], the comic "ROM":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rom_(comics)_ and several Japanese [[tokusatsu]] series from the early 80s like [[uchuu_keiji_gavan|Space Sheriff Gavan]] and the [[Metal Hero]] series.

h4. See also

* [[Auto-9]], Robocop's signature weapon
* [[ED-2 (Modern Mogal)]]
* [[Lady BattleCop (character)|]]

title: naenia_(vanitas_no_carte)
body: Naenia (ネーニア, Nēnia) is a major antagonist from Jun Mochizuki's The Case Study of Vanitas. She is the mysterious ethereal entity responsible for infecting curse-bearing Vampires with Malnomen in a hunt for their True Names. She is a member of Charlatan, who help facilitate her creation of curse-bearers to yet unclear ends. As her goal and very existence is in direct opposition to that of Vanitas and Noé, who fight to cure curse-bearers, she and they remain in constant conflict for the duration of the series.

title: pekomama
body:
[[Usada Pekora]]'s [[real life insert|real]] mother. After surpassing a million subscribers, Pekora fulfilled a promise she'd made a while before and revealed to her mother, live and on stream, her occupation as a [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. She is usually depicted as an older, motherly Pekora. However, she does not hesitate to embarrass Pekora whenever possible.

On April 1st 2024, she got her own "official" 2D model designed by [[hikosan]] and had her first solo stream on Pekora's channel. That said livestream later became viral, and spawned numerous NSFW art of her in the process.

Like her daughter, she is a [[rabbit girl]] with [[rabbit ears]] and [[rabbit tail|tail]]. She has [[red eyes]] with [[rabbit-shaped pupils]] and [[short eyebrows|short]] [[thick eyebrows]] . For her outfit, she wears a [[white dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] worn over a [[black bodysuit]], a [[black pantyhose]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[bunny slippers]].

For her default hairstyle, she has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair|blue]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair]] tied into a [[braided ponytail]] [[hair over shoulder|that goes over her shoulder]] held with a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]].

h4. Appearance

title: 2000s_(style)
body:
Anime or manga art styles that were popular during the 2000s. This tag should not be used for images created in the 2000s that do not fall into this specific art style.

Western artists with a fondness for this style tend to tag their artwork as "animecore":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Animecore, a term coined in Tumblr aesthetic communities in the late 2010s to refer to the imagery and culture surrounding anime in the 2000s.

h4. Common characteristics

* Bold black lineart
* [[anime coloring|Animation cel]] style shading
* Soft, pillowy shading with no defined form
* Freeform-shaped, "glossy" hair highlights with a low opacity 
* "Moe" proportions (large eyes, small dot noses, low-placed mouths)
* Eyes without a defined pupil, instead being blurred with a darker shade or having a loose freeform shaped shadow
* Solid, round eye catchlights
* Common geometric eye shapes like [[jitome]] or [[tsurime]]
* Sharp, upturned eyelashes
* Stereotypical anime expressions ([[>_<]], [[:3]], [[blush stickers]] and lines, exaggerated [[sweatdrop]]s)
* Hair drawn with sharp shapes

Shoujo art is typically traditional media, particularly [[colored pencil (medium)|]] or [[watercolor (medium)|]]. Eyes are more rounded and detailed. [[Sparkle]]s are frequently used.

h4. Examples

* !post #1276096: A 2000s style commonly seen in shoujo manga
* !post #117911: A 2000s style commonly seen in anime and visual novels
* !post #7939968: Modern artwork in a 2000s style
* !post #7767789: Modern artwork inspired by 2000s styles

h4. See also

* [[1990s (style)]]
* [[y2k fashion]]
