title: anabel_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Anabel[/b], known as [b]Lila[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon emerald|Emerald]][/i].

This skilled Trainer is full of mysteries due to memory loss. She's on the trail of Ultra Beasts as the head of the UB Task Force, a secret division of the International Police [tn](official bio)[/tn].

In her [[pokemon sm|SM]] outfit, she has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]. She wears a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with a [[black necktie]] under a [[black jacket|black]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] jacket, [[black gloves]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

body:

title: zarya_petrovic
body:
Zarya Petrovic (callsign "Skorpion", later "Icarus") is an OC created by LapisLumos in 2023 and first designed by [[Chen Feng (slbdofcl)|]].

She is an Albino Bosnian Serbian soldier belonging to the [[Scorpions (paramilitary)|Skorpions]] paramilitary group. She is usually depicted with a red [[beret]] and a [[kolovrat (symbol)|]] [[silver necklace|silver]] [[necklace]].

She was designed to be [[Alpha (Alpha 1918)|]]'s unofficial mother.

title: mitsubishi
body:
[b]Mitsubishi Group[/b] is a major Japanese conglomerate company, currently the largest company in [[Japan]].

Mitsubishi's history can be traced back to the Meiji era, where they were one of the first heavy industry company in Japan. The company became a major [i]zaibatsu[/i] company (Japanese word for major family-run business that held a large stake of the country's economy) during late 1900s, producing wide array of products. Ranging from pencil to warships.

Mitsubishi were split up in 1946, following [[World War II]] as a part of anti-trust policy by the occupying United States. They would later regrouped in 1950s, though each associated companies is largely independent from the main branch.

h4. Subsidiaries
* [[Mitsubishi Electric]]
* [[Mitsubishi Fusou]]
* [[Mitsubishi Heavy Industries]]
* [[Mitsubishi Motors]]

title: nazi
body:
A post displaying Nazi imagery, symbols or characters being adherent to Nazism; such as use of the [[Nazi flag]], the [[Nazi war ensign]] or the [[reichsadler]] featuring a [[swastika]].

Not to be used for mere depictions of the [[Wehrmacht]], [[Kriegsmarine]] or [[Luftwaffe]].

In some parts of the world it is illegal to display or advertise Nazi imagery, so [[censored symbol]]s such as sad emojis or X on an [[armband]] may be displayed to get around censorship or avoid attention. This tag includes those examples as well, as long as they are clear Nazi references.

h4. Nazi symbolism

* [[Black Sun (symbol)|]]
* [[Deutsches Ahnenerbe]] 
* [[swastika|Hakenkreuz (swastika)]]
* [[Nazi flag]]
** [[Nazi war ensign]]

* [[Siegrunen|Siegrunen]]

The [[Iron Cross]] and [[Balkenkreuz]] are not Nazi symbols.

title: ku_klux_klan
body:
A [[racism|white supremacist]] group originating in the Southern United States in the aftermath of the [[American Civil War]] as a backlash against the newly freed slaves, then revived in the 1920s and again after WWII. Infamous for their [[white hood]]s, burning crosses, lynchings and others murders.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan]

title: confederate_flag
body:
Dating to the [[American Civil War]], the flag popularly known as the confederate flag was the battle flag used by the [[Confederate States of America]]'s Army of Northern Virginia, and was also used as the CSA's naval ensign displayed as a smaller canton with a white field.

Contrary to popular belief, it was never used as the national flag of the Confederacy, nor was it used by any of the Confederacy's armies west of Virginia. It is sometimes mistakenly called "Stars and Bars", which was the nickname of the actual first national flag of the Confederate States.

After the war, the ANV battle flag was adopted by many pro-Confederate groups, leading to its status as a divisive symbol today. In modern days, the flags are associated with white supremacy and [[racism]] in a similar vein to the [[Nazi flag]].

All flags connected to the Confederate States other than the aformentioned flag could be also be given the 'confederate_flag' tag.

h4. See also
* [[Ku Klux Klan]]
other_names: アメリカ連合国の国旗

title: confederate_states_of_america
body:
The [b]Confederate States of America (CSA)[/b] was a secessionist state that existed from 1861 to 1865, it was formed when a number of states from the [[United States]] of America decided to secede from the union in the name of State's rights to [[slave]]ry. Ultimately, a total of 11 states join the Confederacy. Not recognized by any major country during its brief existence.

Use this tag when the post directly refer to the CSA, such as its military during the [[American Civil War]]. Do not apply this tag if the post simply featuring the [[Confederate flag]] as a motif.

h4. See also
* [[American Civil War]]
* [[Confederate flag]]
* [[Ku Klux Klan]]

title: 9/11_tourist_guy_(meme)
body:
A hoax that featured a digitally altered photograph of a tourist on the observation deck of the [[World Trade Center]], supposedly on the day of the [[9/11|September 11 attacks]], showing a plane about to hit the tower in the background.

The photo became an Internet phenomenon as many manipulated pictures spread online. The man in the photograph was ultimately identified as Hungarian Péter Guzli, who took the photo in 1997. Guzli said he edited the photo as a joke for his friends and did not realize it would spread across the Internet.

h4.See also

* "Original hoax photo":https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/05/Tourist_guy.jpg

title: stepan_(number-seventeen)
body:
Stepan is a male Ukrainian character belonging to the 67th Mechanized Brigade, a [[Right Sector]]-derivative unit.

He is often depicted with a [[jacket]], [[baggy pants]], [[boots]], [[gloves]], and a [[blue beanie|blue]] [[beanie]]. His weapon of choice is an [[AK-47]].

Created by [[Biswapriya Purkayastha]] in 2022 to mock Ukrainian ultranationalists in the comic [i]Tales of Ukranazistan[/i] after the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]] began, his original full name was "Ukranazi Stepan". [[Marichka]]'s newfound notoriety on /pol/ inspired [[Number-Seventeen]] to draw Stepan as an aesthetically-appealing character to ship with her in a series of comics, with his rather-unbelievable backstory utterly unchanged. LapisLumos' and [[Linyvets chan]]'s contributions gave Stepan [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and greater depth, fully diverging the character from the original.

h4. External links

* "Marichka Wiki (English)":https://marichka.fandom.com/wiki/Stepan
* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/%D0%A1%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%BD
* "Original Comic's Telegram":https://t.me/TalesOfUkranazistan
* "Original Author's Wordpress":https://ragheadthefiendlyterrorist.wordpress.com/
* "Original Author's Blogspot (inactive)":https://bill-purkayastha.blogspot.com/

title: hokkaido
body:
[b]Hokkaido[/b] is the largest prefecture in Japan and the largest of the northern islands. Its capital is [[Sapporo (city)|]].

h4. Locations

* [[Hakodate (city)|]]
* [[Otaru (hokkaido)|]]
* [[Sapporo (city)|]]
* [[Wakkanai]]

Shorthand for September 11, [[2001]]. A [[terrorism|terrorist attack]] involving two planes hijacked by Al-Qaeda [[terrorist]]s flew into the [[World Trade Center|Twin Towers]], causing them to collapse top-down onto the streets of [[New York City]]. Another plane was flown into the Pentagon building in Arlington, Virginia while a fourth, presumed to be targeting somewhere in [[Washington D.C.]] was deliberately crashed near Shanksville, Pennsylvania as its passengers fought to regain control from the terrorists. The death toll is currently at 2,996, including 17 hijackers.

The event is widely considered by Americans to be the true start of the 2000s, as well as a catalyst of the "War on Terror", a series of armed involvement of the US and allies in the middle east under the pretext of eliminating terrorism. Chief among these conflicts were as the [[War in Afghanistan|American invasion of Afghanistan in 2001]] and [[Iraq War|Iraq in 2003]], and to an extent, the [[Syrian Civil War]].

Due to various factors, the event has spawned numerous jokes and [[meme]]s. The earliest was about various conspiracy theory alleged that the event was an inside job orchestrated by then-US President [[george w. bush|George W. Bush]] as a [i]casus belli[/i] for the war in the middle east, such as "Bush did 9/11" and "jet fuel don't melt steel beams". Though later on, 9/11 imagery or reference has gained resurgence as a part of Gen Z humor, primarily for the shock value or as an "edgy" punchline.

The most common depiction of the event depicts [[smoke]] exiting either of the towers.

h4. See also

* [[9/11 tourist guy (meme)]]
* [[A second plane has hit the x (meme)]]
* [[War in Afghanistan]]
* [[Iraq War]]
* [[World Trade Center]]
* [[Osama Bin Laden]]
* [[Tag group:history]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: September 11 attacks":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/September_11_attacks]

title: argonauts_(fate)
body:
A post that features [b]four or more[/b] of the Argonauts from [[Fate (series)|]]. This includes the original Argonauts from [[Greek mythology]] and the Neo-Argonauts seen in the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt.

See {{argonauts_(fate) -atlantis_(fate/grand_order)}} for posts focusing on the historical Argonauts and {{argonauts_(fate) atlantis_(fate/grand_order)}} for posts focusing on the Neo-Argonauts.

The original Argonauts include:

* [[Jason (fate)|]] 
* [[Heracles (fate)|]]
* [[Medea (fate)|]]/[[Medea (lily) (fate)|Medea Lily]]
* [[Atalanta (fate)|]]
* [[Asclepius (fate)|]]
* [[Theseus (fate)|]]
* [[Castor (fate)|]]
* [[Pollux (fate)|]] 
* [[Caenis (fate)|]]
* [[Peleus (fate)|]]

The Neo-Argonauts are comprised of:

* [[Jason (fate)|]]
* [[Achilles (fate)|]]
* [[Bartholomew Roberts (fate)|]]
* [[Charlotte Corday (fate)|]]
* [[Mandricardo (fate)|]]
* [[Super Orion (fate)|]]
* [[Paris (fate)|]]
* [[Mochizuki Chiyome (fate)|]]

While not historically Argonauts, Jason [[gameplay mechanics|can buff]] the "Argo-related" Greek servants [[Chiron (fate)|]], [[Circe (fate)|]], and [[Nemo (fate)|Triton]].

title: kitchen_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Fire
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can add 1 "Dragonmaid" monster from your Deck to your hand, except "Kitchen Dragonmaid", then send 1 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand to the GY. At the start of the Battle Phase: You can return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 8 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Kitchen Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1700


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Tinkhec]] in her dragon form. The Dragonmaid archetype's chef, as indicated by her title. She has [[red hair]], [[horns|teal horns]], red draconic wings, and a big dragon tail. 
Kitchen often depicted as a typical [[tsundere]] in some arts may be from the description that she's not used to getting compliments from Card Game Art Works. She's also drawn as got her cooked sweet stolen by [[Parlor Dragonmaid]].
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ティルル
ドラゴンメイド・フランメ

title: lattice_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level[/b]: 8
[b]Attribute[/b]: LIGHT
[b]Type[/b]: Dragon / Fusion / Effect

[i]2 "Dragonmaid" monsters with the same Attribute but different Levels
Must first be Special Summoned (from your Extra Deck) by banishing 1 each of the above cards from your field and GY. You can only use each of the following effects of "Lattice Dragonmaid" once per turn. If this card is Special Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 Level 4 or lower "Dragonmaid" monster from your Deck. During the Standby Phase: You can Fusion Summon 1 Dragon Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck, by shuffling its materials from your field and/or banishment into the Deck.[/i]

[b]ATK[/b]: 2000 
[b]DEF[/b]: 3000

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. She is first introduced in 2024 and is currently the newest member of the archetype.

She is frequently paired with [[Chamber Dragonmaid]] in fanarts, typically as Chamber's one-sided "rival". This is due to her debut overshadowed Chamber receiving [[Dragonmaid Stern|her long anticipated dragon form]] that were introduced in the same set.
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ラティス

title: dragonmaid_sheou
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 10
[b]Attribute:[/b] Light
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 "Dragonmaid" monster + 1 Level 5 or higher Dragon monster
During each Standby Phase: You can Special Summon 1 Level 9 or lower "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. When your opponent activates a card or effect (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that card, also, after that, return this card to the Extra Deck, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "House Dragonmaid" from your Extra Deck. You can only use each effect of "Dragonmaid Sheou" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3500
[b]DEF:[/b] 2000


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. She is [[dragon]] form of [[House Dragonmaid]]. Unlike the other maid, [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] is currently the only bipedal dragon in the Dragonmaid archetype. She also has the highest Level (10) and original ATK (3500) of all Dragonmaid dragon form. Although Dragonmaid Sheou has Light attribute, her scale color is black, which is more likely Dark attribute monsters' color.
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・シュトラール

title: philia_regis
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 8
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 Dragon Fusion Monster + 1 Level 7 or higher Dragon monster
During the Main Phase (Quick Effect): You can target 1 card your opponent controls or in their GY; banish it, then, if it was banished from the field, return 1 Dragon monster you control to the hand. At the start of your opponent's Battle Phase, if this card is in your GY: You can return 1 Dragon monster you control to the hand/Extra Deck, and if you do, Special Summon this card. You can only use each effect of "Philia Regis" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3000
[b]DEF:[/b] 2500

A new [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] featured in the Alliance Insight core booster box. [[Philia Regis]] is likely an indirect support to Dragonmaid archetype, due to being a Dragon Fusion Monster with effects that rely on returning Dragon monsters from the field to the hand.

title: d4dj
body:
D4DJ ("Dig Delight Direct Drive DJ") is a [[DJ]]-themed multimedia franchise originally by Bushiroad. Launched in 2020, the franchise currently consists of a mobile game, an anime, and a manga, as well as live DJ performances.

In 2024, Bushiroad transferred ownership of D4DJ to Donuts, the company operating the mobile game.

title: minato_aqua_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Minato Aqua]]. This costume was designed by [[Topia]].

It consists of a [[maid headdress]] with an [[anchor symbol]], a [[blue dress|blue]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[short dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] with an [[anchor print]], a [[blue bowtie]], a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[framed breasts|breast frame]] and that is decorated with small [[white bow|white]] [[dress bow|bows]] and a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]]. She also wears [[wrist cuffs]], frilled [[ankle cuffs]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[mary janes]] with [[footwear bow|bows on them]]. 

h4. Other names

Her default costume was given the name [i]Virtual Marine Maid[/i] (バーチャルマリンメイド) in the [i][[Azur Lane]][/i] 2019 collaboration event, since she uses a one-piece swimsuit variant of the default as her main shipgirl costume.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3931939: Profile (2D)
* !post #8056007: Profile (3D)
* !post #5872545: Merchandise
* !post #3627759: L2D
other_names: バーチャルマリンメイド

title: genjitsu_no_yohane
body:
In English, [i]Yohane the Parhelion[/i]. Also subtitled [i]Sunshine in the Mirror[/i], it is a [i][[Love Live! Sunshine!!]][/i] fantasy spin-off with an anime that debuted in 2023.

The first mention of an anime was as an April Fool's 2022 joke on the official [i]Love Live![/i] YouTube channel (the original has since been deleted from the official channel, but not before being "translated":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XSflX-60EAI]). On June 26, 2022, a "separate dedicated twitter account":[https://twitter.com/GJ_yohane/status/1541041754958630913] as well as a live announcement at an Aqours live confirmed that the spin-off was in the works.

The series casts Aqours in a completely new setting, set in a fantasy world version in the land of "Numazu", named after the Shizuoka Prefecture city and its surroundings (including Uchiura) that [i]Sunshine!![/i] is set in, and stars [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] as [[Yohane (genjitsu no yohane)|]] (Yoshiko's preferred fallen angel name). It tells "the story that no one knows about a girl that everyone knows," where she journeys and meets fantasy versions of other characters.

In June 2023, "[i]Blaze in the Deepblue[/i]":[http://yohane-bid.com/en/], a 2D action platform video game for the series in the vein of [i][[Metroid]][/i] and [i][[Castlevania (series)|]][/i], was announced after it itself was an April Fool's joke in 2023. Developed by Inti Creates, it is the first [i]Love Live![/i] console game released November 16, 2023 for [[Nintendo Switch]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[PlayStation 5|5]], [[Xbox One]] and [[Xbox Series X|Series X/S]] and [[Steam (platform)|]].

h4. Characters

title: nurse_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 2
[b]Attribute:[/b] Earth
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned : You can target 1 Level 4 or lower " Dragonmaid " monster in your GY , except "Nurse Dragonmaid"; Special Summon it. At the start of the Battle Phase : You can return this card to the hand , and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 7 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Nurse Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1600

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Dragonmaid" archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Ernus]] in her dragon form. Easily recognised by her pink [[nurse]] uniform. Nurse Dragonmaid appears as a careful and kindness senior, or even as an older sister, as she often depicted caring or worry for [[Laundry dragonmaid]] in official card artworks
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ナサリー

title: parlor_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Wind
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned : You can send 1 " Dragonmaid " card from your Deck to the GY , except "Parlor Dragonmaid". At the start of the Battle Phase : You can return this card to the hand , and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 8 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Parlor Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1700

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Lorpar]] in her dragon form. She has a plant theming to her, complete with a leafy tail and wings.

Parlor Dragonmaid is notorious for binging on sweets to the point where she steals some behind [[Kitchen Dragonmaid]]'s back and even petitions her for more sweets. In fan arts, she is also often depicted as a "sister figure" of [[Laundry Dragonmaid]].
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・パルラ

title: savior_(eversoul)
body:
The player character and protagonist of [[Eversoul]].

He was once just a normal human from 21st century Earth, until one day, he was suddenly summoned to Eden (an alternate Earth set in the distant future) by the summoning ritual of the Souls [[Mephistopheles (Eversoul)|]] and Queen [[Yuria (Eversoul)|]] to be chosen as the Savior of Souls and the new administrator of the first Ark "Metatron". He holds Dominion over Soul Mastery, allowing him to create mutual contracts with Souls wherein they gain greater power than before in exchange for them assisting him in battles when needed, though his physiological disadvantages as a normal human and his general lack of experience prevents him from fully utilizing his power.

He's currently the only human on the Souls' side of the war against the Gates and also the only "old" human (Homo sapiens) within the setting. [spoilers]He would later become one of two humans aided by Souls in fighting against the predestined apocalypse alongside former enemy and fellow Soul Master Kayrin Faust.[/spoilers]

[spoiler]His true role is later revealed to be the Singularity, a special being chosen by the universe to hold the innate ability to defy conventional space-time laws and create branches in time with each choice they confront while also being the telltale sign of their world's imminent apocalypse once certain conditions are met.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance
* !post #5875427: Key visual
* !post #5860306: Key visual
He is a young human man, presumably in between his late teens to early adulthood, with [[brown hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. His usual attire mostly follows the same color scheme as Mephi and Yuria, consisting of him wearing a [[black shirt|black]] [[turtleneck]] shirt under a [[white coat]] with various [[gold|golden]] [[jewelry]] and a [[single pauldron|single]] golden [[pauldron]] on his left shoulder, followed by [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pants]] and [[white footwear|boots]]. He's usually seen with a small [[cane]] either held by his left hand or strapped to his waist, which he uses both as a blunt weapon and a magic tool for his Soul Master abilities.

His face has only been shown in his in-game portrait, promotional art, and 3D in-game cutscenes. Most CGs that show him usually keep his [[head out of frame]] as per his role as a self-insert character.

title: fake_hisui_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018905

Nisemono daga ii-yatsu sou na Hisui-san; "Although-she-is-a-fake-but-she-looks-like-a-nice-person Hisui-san", shortened to Nise-Hisui. A [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]] character originating from "this niconico video":[http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm28465189].

She is a parody of [[Hisui (cookie)|]], with a [[:3]] mouth and [[solid circle eyes]], very simple [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]], one hand doing a [[v]] with the other [[arm behind back|hand either behind her back]] or [[amputee|amputated]]. To compensate her being drawn extremely simple, she is animated very well often using [[rotoscoping]]. Other Cookie characters use motion tweens or MMD models with canned animations; Fake Hisui is hand-animated. Another common joke is giving her [[large breasts|larger breasts]] than Hisui.

h4.External Link
* "Nicopedia article":[http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/5422624]
other_names: 偽物だがいいやつそうなHSIさん

title: noel_vermillion
body:
Female character from [i][[BlazBlue]][/i].

Noel Vermillion is a lieutenant of the NOL (Novus Orbis Librarium), who dual-wields a set of handguns named Arcus Diabolus Bolverk. She works as a direct subordinate of Major [[Jin Kisaragi]].

Her hobbies include online shopping and poetry (she refuses to show others her poems). She deeply dislikes insects.

She [[dual wielding|wields]] the Nox Nyctores [[Bolverk]].

Voiced in Japanese by [[Kondou Kanako]] and English by [[Cristina Valenzuela]].

title: v
body:
Making a '[b]V[/b]' shape with the index and middle finger, like this: ✌️. Use [[W]] instead if the thumb is open too.

Most of the time it's simply a visual equivalent of "yo!", something you make when posing for pictures. It is sometimes called "peace sign" or "V sign" or "victory sign".

In the case of the circular peace sign (☮) then [[peace_symbol|peace symbol]] should be used instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #6074631

h4. Variations

* [[V over eye]]
* [[V over mouth]]
* [[double V]]
* [[gyaru v]] (an upside-down v with the arm stretched out in front of the character)
* [[inward v]]
** [[double inward v]]
* [[bent v]]

h4. See also

title: strike_witches
body:
[b]Strike Witches[/b] is a light novel and anime series set in an alternate [[World War II]] setting in which the nations of the world band together to defend against an alien invasion. Their only trump cards are witches (genderswapped versions of real life World War II fighter pilots) who don engine-shaped leggings known as [[striker unit]]s to fly and do battle in the sky. 

The series later spawned several sequels and spin-offs, which were later collectively named the [[World Witches Series]].

*Written by [[Yamaguchi Noboru]]
*Illustrated by [[Shimada Fumikane]], [[Ueda Hashigo]]

title: piranimon
body:
A vicious Aquatic Digimon that acts in large schools. The exoskeleton that covers Piranimon’s head enhances the power of its jaws, helping it to crush foes with its sharp fangs. The sheer power of its bite is said to rival Mammothmon’s stomp.
Piranimon uses Cruel Invitation to run through prey with its fishhook-like tail and drag them into the water. Then it clamps down on them with its bite and rapidly spins around with Calamity Vise, riddling their body with holes as it finishes them off. Since Piranimon target lone Digimon and attack in groups, they leave behind no trace of their prey’s data.

title: error.mdl
body:
[b]error.mdl[/b] refers to a red 3D error sign used in [[Valve Software]]'s Source Engine as a placeholder for missing model files. Over the years the model has gained relevance in pop culture, alongside the pink and black checkered placeholder pattern that the engine uses for missing texture files.
